original: des na zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa de'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa de'o //
translated: “Therefore” means “because of that impossibility.”

original: mi skyed pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba yin no zhes skabs kyis so //
analyzed: mi skyed pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba yin no zhes skabs kyis so //
translated: “It does not produce” is the contradiction.

original: 'o na sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa dag la 'gal ba 'di ji ltar zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa dag la 'gal ba 'di ji ltar zhe na ;
translated: “But how is there a contradiction between blue and non-blue?”

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “How?”

original: sngon po nyid la sogs pa ni sngon po'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po nyid la sogs pa ni sngon po'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Blue, etc. is only the nature of blue, and it is the producer.

original: ser po la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i rang bzhin ni skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i rang bzhin ni skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not able to produce the nature that is together with yellow, etc.

original: 'o na ji ltar slob dpon chos mchog gi lugs bzhin du tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar slob dpon chos mchog gi lugs bzhin du tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “But how is there a difference according to the system of Master Dharmottara?”

original: 'gal ba 'di gnyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'di gnyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “These two contradictions”

original: gal te 'di gnyis la rnam pa ci zhig ltar khyad par yod du chug pa de lta na yang skye ba med pas byas pa'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te 'di gnyis la rnam pa ci zhig ltar khyad par yod du chug pa de lta na yang skye ba med pas byas pa'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If these two are allowed to have some kind of difference, still, because of non-production, there is no difference at all that is made. This is the meaning.

original: ser po dang sngon po bzhin du me dang bcas pas de dang bral ba 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ser po dang sngon po bzhin du me dang bcas pas de dang bral ba 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Like yellow and blue, it is incompatible with that which is associated with fire.

original: rgyu'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa las so //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa las so //
translated: “By the power of the cause” means as explained above.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: “That” refers to the nature of the incompatible characteristics.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni don gyi rang bzhin ma yin na me la sogs pa'i don rnams kyi nges pa'i rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni don gyi rang bzhin ma yin na me la sogs pa'i don rnams kyi nges pa'i rang bzhin med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if it were not the nature of the object, it would follow that the objects such as fire would have no definite nature.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i don gyi rang bzhin yin na @138b gang gis mi dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i don gyi rang bzhin yin na @138b gang gis mi dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is the nature of the incompatible object, how can non-apprehension be non-apprehension by that?

original: de dag ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says “those” [are non-apprehension].

original: dbang po las 'das pa ni 'ga' yang lhan cig 'gal ba yod par mi 'grub pa des na 'gal ba dmigs pa srid pa la yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa ni 'ga' yang lhan cig 'gal ba yod par mi 'grub pa des na 'gal ba dmigs pa srid pa la yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Since it is not established that anything transcendent is simultaneously incompatible, he says “it is possible for the apprehension of the incompatible to exist.”

original: dbang po las 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “beyond the scope of the senses.”

original: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis kyang med pa mi 'grub po zhes sbyar ro /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis kyang med pa mi 'grub po zhes sbyar ro /
translated: “ Merely not perceiving something does not establish its nonexistence.”

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma dmigs so zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: ma dmigs so zhes bya bas so //
translated: “ Because of not perceiving it.”

original: 'o na mi dmigs pa las med par brjod pa ni mdzes par 'gyur ba de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi dmigs pa las med par brjod pa ni mdzes par 'gyur ba de gang yin zhe na /
translated: “ But it is more elegant to say that nonexistence is due to nonapprehension.”

original: gang gi zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang gi zhes smos so //
translated: “ Whose?”

original: 'o na de nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: “ But then you are refuting omniscience itself.”

original: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ At that time, too.”

original: 'o na thams cad mkhyen pa mi spong mod /
analyzed: 'o na thams cad mkhyen pa mi spong mod /
translated: “ But you are not refuting omniscience itself.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs par 'gyur ro zhe na 'jig rten pha rol zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs par 'gyur ro zhe na 'jig rten pha rol zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is just that there is no world beyond this one.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “ Why is that?”

original: de la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs so //
translated: “ Because of that.”

original: de ltar gnod byed med pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnod byed med pa brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having stated the absence of refutation,

original: sgrub par byed pa yod pa brjod pa ni /🔽bzlog pa la ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yod pa brjod pa ni /🔽bzlog pa la ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he states the presence of proof:🔽“ The opposite is the case.”

original: thams cad rig pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa'i tshad ma ni tshad ma grub pa'i le 'ur bshad zin to /
analyzed: thams cad rig pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa'i tshad ma ni tshad ma grub pa'i le 'ur bshad zin to /
translated: The valid cognition of the existence of other worlds has been explained in the chapter on valid cognition.

original: // / gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur pa rnams la dmigs pa las med par nges pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur pa rnams la dmigs pa las med par nges pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that there is no object of observation for the imperceptible.

original: yang na ji ltar dmigs pa las yod par grub pa de bzhin du ma dmigs pa las kyang med pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar dmigs pa las yod par grub pa de bzhin du ma dmigs pa las kyang med pa 'grub bo //
translated: Or, just as existence is established from the observation of an object, so nonexistence is established from the nonobservation of an object.

original: des na ma dmigs par nges byed ji ltar ma yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas ji ltar zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: des na ma dmigs par nges byed ji ltar ma yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas ji ltar zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, anticipating the qualm, “How can nonobservation ascertain nonexistence?” he says, “Just as . . .”

original: dper na du ba la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: dper na du ba la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyis grub pa ste /
translated: For example, the existence of things such as smoke is established by the existence of other imperceptible things.

original: nges pa la sgrub par byed par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du dngos po nyid rang log pa na dngos po rnams kyi ldog byed du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: nges pa la sgrub par byed par 'dod pa'i dmigs pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du dngos po nyid rang log pa na dngos po rnams kyi ldog byed du 'dod kyi /
translated: Just as the observation that is asserted to be the proof of the ascertainment of the existence of things such as smoke is not the proof of the existence of other imperceptible things, so the existence of things is asserted to be the proof of the ascertainment of the existence of other things.

original: mi dmigs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that nonobservation is not the proof of the nonexistence of things.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: “How?” is an inquiry.

original: ldog pa brjod pa ni 'brel pa med pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ldog pa brjod pa ni 'brel pa med pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The expression of the negation is “If there were no connection . . .”

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'brel pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'brel pas so //
translated: “In the same way” is by way of the connection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'brel pa med par ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa med par ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: “If there were no connection . . .”

original: spyir brjod pa'i don khyad par gyi mthar thug par byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyir brjod pa'i don khyad par gyi mthar thug par byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The general expression of the meaning is brought to a conclusion with the particular, as in “For example . . .”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If it were not so . . .”

original: gal te khyab par byed pa med pas khyab par bya ba med par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te khyab par byed pa med pas khyab par bya ba med par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the pervaded were not absent when the pervader is absent,

original: de'i tshe 'brel pa de yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'brel pa de yin no //
translated: then there would be no connection.

original: dngos po sgrub byed nyid du bstan pa'i zhar la dngos po med par 'dod pa tsam las byung ba'i sgrub par @139a * //🔽byed pa yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po sgrub byed nyid du bstan pa'i zhar la dngos po med par 'dod pa tsam las byung ba'i sgrub par @139a * // byed pa yin pa nyid do //
translated: In the course of teaching that the thing is the proof, the non-thing is the mere object of the desire to prove.

original: brjod pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression is “This . . .”

original: dngos po nyid sgrub par byed par bstan pa las so //
analyzed: dngos po nyid sgrub par byed par bstan pa las so //
translated: It is from the teaching that the thing itself is the proof.

original: sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid kyi chos bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa'am mi rtag pa nyid ci yang rung ba la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid kyi chos bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa'am mi rtag pa nyid ci yang rung ba la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for any property to be established that is not a counter-correlate of the property to be established, whether it be permanent or impermanent.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar srid snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar srid snyam na /
translated: Why is it impossible?

original: gang gi phyir rtogs pas sbyar ba'i chos yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs pas sbyar ba'i chos yin pas so //
translated: Because it is a property that is posited by conceptual thought.

original: dngos po'i chos ma yin pa kho na sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos ma yin pa kho na sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is only a property that is not an entity that is established, not anything else.

original: ji ltar 'dis 'di gsal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis 'di gsal zhe na /
translated: How does this make it clear?

original: phyogs dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyogs dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “the property-possessor and the property.”

original: ji ltar na gnyis las gcig dang ma 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnyis las gcig dang ma 'brel zhe na /
translated: How is it that one of the two is not related?

original: phyogs ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyogs ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “the property.”

original: de lta bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas byas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas byas pa kho na'o //
translated: “Just like that” means “only by desire.”

original: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: In this way, the universal of the property to be established is the property-possessor that is concordant with the property.

original: de yang na ji ltar de dang de las mthun pa'i phyogs mtshungs pa don dam pa ma yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang na ji ltar de dang de las mthun pa'i phyogs mtshungs pa don dam pa ma yin par 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, how could that which is similar to that and that be a non-ultimate?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni las so //🔽ji ltar go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni las so // ji ltar go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: “ Entity” means an object.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to the doubt, “How is it not an expression?” it is said, “Because there is no concomitance and no reversal.”

original: gzhan du zhes gsungs so zhes 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes gsungs so zhes 'dod pa la'o //
translated: This is asserted in the statement, “Otherwise.”

original: gzhan ni dngos po'o //🔽rjes su 'gro ba med pa brjod nas ldog pa med pa brjod pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni dngos po'o // rjes su 'gro ba med pa brjod nas ldog pa med pa brjod pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “ Otherwise” means an entity.

original: ldog par byed pas so //
analyzed: ldog par byed pas so //
translated: Having stated the absence of concomitance, the absence of reversal is stated in “By what,” which means by reversal.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag go //
translated: “ That” refers to the permanent and the impermanent.

original: 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'am mi rtag pa las so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'am mi rtag pa las so //
translated: “ From some” means from the permanent or the impermanent.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po dang 'brel pa ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos po dang 'brel pa ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because it is not related to an entity in that way, therefore.

original: 'o na ji ltar sgrub pa dgag pa 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sgrub pa dgag pa 'grub ce na /
translated: Well then, how is the negation of establishment established?

original: bshad pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is “Therefore.”

original: ci dngos po mtha' dag dang ldog pa na dngos po mtha' dag gi ldog par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci dngos po mtha' dag dang ldog pa na dngos po mtha' dag gi ldog par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Does the negation of all things negate all things?

original: 'on te 'ga' kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Or does it negate some?

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ste dngos po rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ste dngos po rnams la'o //
translated: “In that case” means in regard to things.

original: khyab par byed pa ldog pa gcig khyab par bya ba ldog pa go bar byed pa yin gyi khyab par byed pa yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ldog pa gcig khyab par bya ba ldog pa go bar byed pa yin gyi khyab par byed pa yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The negation of the pervader makes known the negation of the pervaded, but it is not the negator of the pervaded.

original: gang gi tshe zhes gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “When” means “if.”

original: 'dis ni thams cad ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi @139b 'on kyang khyab par byed pa kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi @139b 'on kyang khyab par byed pa kho na ma yin te /
translated: This shows that not all things are negators, but only the pervader is the negator.

original: des na dngos po rnams bsgrubs la //
analyzed: des na dngos po rnams bsgrubs la //
translated: Therefore, things are established.

original: dngos nyid sgrub par byed par 'dod //
analyzed: dngos nyid sgrub par byed par 'dod //
translated: But it is not maintained that existence itself is a negator.

original: ces bya ba yang thams cad la ni ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba yang thams cad la ni ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This also shows that not all things are negated.

original: spyir brjod pa tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i don 'dir bsdus te 'dzin pas bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: spyir brjod pa tshigs su bcad pa snga ma'i don 'dir bsdus te 'dzin pas bsdu ba ste /
translated: This is a summary, because the meaning of the earlier verse is summarized here.

original: khyad par du rnam par 'jog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par 'jog par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In particular, it means “that which determines.”

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la yang zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la yang zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the objection, “Also, with regard to the non-apprehension of an intrinsic reality,” is as follows:

original: dmigs pa log pa snang ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yang dngos po'i byed pa zhes ldog par byed pa yin no zhes ni ci ste brjod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa log pa snang ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yang dngos po'i byed pa zhes ldog par byed pa yin no zhes ni ci ste brjod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: “Why do you say that the negation of an object, the non-apprehension of an appearance, is the cause of the negation of an intrinsic reality?”

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'i go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'i go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply, “The non-apprehension of an intrinsic reality does not prove the non-existence of an entity,” is “In that case . . .”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because of the non-apprehension of an object . . .”

original: skabs kyi rtsod pa bsal nas gal te rang gi ldog pa ni zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi rtsod pa bsal nas gal te rang gi ldog pa ni zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having cleared up the objection in this context, he explains, “If the negation of itself . . .”

original: sgrub pa des zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa des zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By that proof . . .”

original: khyab pa med pas so //
analyzed: khyab pa med pas so //
translated: “Because there is no pervasion . . .”

original: de bas na dngos po nyid ldog pa na dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po nyid ldog pa na dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when an entity is negated, it proves the non-existence of an entity.

original: gal te khyab par byed pa ldog pa ni gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir na mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin rnam nges na rnam 'drar zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te khyab par byed pa ldog pa ni gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir na mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin rnam nges na rnam 'drar zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: If you say: Since the reversal of the pervader is by nature the observation of another, it is not established by direct perception, then why do you say “like the appearance of smoke”?

original: bshad pa gang gi phyir med par bsgrub par bya ba la khyab par byed pa de nyid kyi tshad ma med pa ste mi dmigs pa rtags su brjod pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu rmongs pa'i don du yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa gang gi phyir med par bsgrub par bya ba la khyab par byed pa de nyid kyi tshad ma med pa ste mi dmigs pa rtags su brjod pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu rmongs pa'i don du yin te /
translated: The response is: Because the valid knowledge that is the pervader itself in the proof of nonexistence is the nonobservation of that, which is stated as the reason, it is extremely confused.

original: des na de ltar brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na de ltar brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is stated that way.

original: pa rmongs pa rnams la yang rtags nyid ci ste yin zhe na /
analyzed: pa rmongs pa rnams la yang rtags nyid ci ste yin zhe na /
translated: If it is extremely confused for the confused, then why is it a reason?

original: gnag rid mo bar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnag rid mo bar zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is like a skinny cow.

original: dmigs par dmigs pa ma yin ma dmigs par ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin par byis pa rnams kyis kyang nges pa des na de nges pa'i don du khyab byed mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i ni dmigs pa 'gal ba yin no
analyzed: dmigs par dmigs pa ma yin ma dmigs par ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin par byis pa rnams kyis kyang nges pa des na de nges pa'i don du khyab byed mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i ni dmigs pa 'gal ba yin no
translated: The object of a non-observation is not an observed object. It is the object of the term non-existence. Even the childish ascertain that. Therefore, in the ascertainment of that, the object of a non-observation that is a pervader is contradictory.

original: // yang brjod pa gang yin de ni shin tu rmongs te zhes gang gi don 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: // yang brjod pa gang yin de ni shin tu rmongs te zhes gang gi don 'dzin pa'o //
translated: What is said is that it is extremely confused.

original: shes pa gcig la 'dre ba can gang gi tshad ma med pa mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi med pa la ste /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la 'dre ba can gang gi tshad ma med pa mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi med pa la ste /
translated: The non-observation of that which is suitable to appear in a single cognition is a non-observation of a valid cognition. That itself is non-existence.

original: med pa'i tha snyad la rtags su brjod pa ni shin tu rmongs pa'i don du yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad la rtags su brjod pa ni shin tu rmongs pa'i don du yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement that the non-observation of a related object is a sign of non-existence is for the purpose of extremely confusing the meaning.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The non-observation of an essence is explained.

original: gal te gnag rdzi la sogs pa spyod pa dang bral ba yang 'dir ma rmongs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnag rdzi la sogs pa spyod pa dang bral ba yang 'dir ma rmongs pa yin na /
translated: If even cowherds and so on who are devoid of conduct are not confused in this regard,

original: 'on rmongs pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on rmongs pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: then what is confusion?

original: @140a * // 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @140a * // 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, is said.

original: ji ltar rtogs par byed ce na med pa'i tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs par byed ce na med pa'i tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
translated: How does one realize? By the term “non-existence.”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can du khas mi len pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can du khas mi len pa'o //
translated: “ Otherwise” means if one does not accept the reason of non-apprehension.

original: bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa tha dad par rtogs pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa tha dad par rtogs pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The reason for the realization of the difference of self, pleasure, etc.

original: bstan bcos 'di min na zhes bya ba'o ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di min na zhes bya ba'o ma yin te /
translated: is not this treatise.

original: bstan bcos ni don dang 'brel pa med pas tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos ni don dang 'brel pa med pas tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the treatise is not a valid cognition, since it is not related to the object.

original: bstan bcos nyid dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs par ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos nyid dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs par ma zad pa'o //
translated: “ The treatise itself” means not only pleasure, etc.

original: bstan bcos gzhan kho na las tha dad pa yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan kho na las tha dad pa yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different from other treatises, there would be an infinite regress.

original: gal te phan tshun tha dad par dmigs pa ni tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i 'dod pa nyid yin gyi mi dmigs pa ni ma yin zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun tha dad par dmigs pa ni tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i 'dod pa nyid yin gyi mi dmigs pa ni ma yin zhes dogs na /
translated: If one doubts that the apprehension of mutual difference is the proof of difference, not non-apprehension,

original: tha dad par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha dad par zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says “difference.”

original: mi dmigs pa khas mi len pa la yang nyes pa gzhan dag brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa khas mi len pa la yang nyes pa gzhan dag brjod pa ni /
translated: Another fault is stated even if one does not accept non-apprehension.

original: gsal ba ni zhes bya ba ste gsal ba ni chen po pa nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni zhes bya ba ste gsal ba ni chen po pa nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: “The clear” is the result, such as the state of being great, etc.

original: dmigs pa la ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la ni gtso bo'o //
translated: “The object” is the principal.

original: des dmigs pa gdon mi za par tshad mar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des dmigs pa gdon mi za par tshad mar byas pa yin no //
translated: By that, the object is certainly made the valid cognition.

original: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin gang la ni //
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin gang la ni //
translated: If the nature of an entity is not

original: dngos po yod par rtogs don can //
analyzed: dngos po yod par rtogs don can //
translated: understood to exist,

original: tshad ma lnga po ma skyes pa //
analyzed: tshad ma lnga po ma skyes pa //
translated: the five valid cognitions are not produced.

original: der ni dngos med tshad ma med //
analyzed: der ni dngos med tshad ma med //
translated: There is no valid cognition of non-existence there.

original: ces brjod pa'i phyir tshad ma lnga po med pa yang tshad mar ci'i phyir khas mi len zhe na mi dmigs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ces brjod pa'i phyir tshad ma lnga po med pa yang tshad mar ci'i phyir khas mi len zhe na mi dmigs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said, “The five valid cognitions are not produced,” why is the non-existence of the five valid cognitions not accepted as a valid cognition? “Non-apprehension” is stated.

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshad ma 'di kho na tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba med pa la dngos su med pa'i 'bras bu can yin gyi /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshad ma 'di kho na tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba med pa la dngos su med pa'i 'bras bu can yin gyi /
translated: This non-apprehension alone is the valid cognition that directly has the result of the non-existence of the object to be established.

original: tshad ma rtogs pa ni ma yin te sngar nyid bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma rtogs pa ni ma yin te sngar nyid bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The understanding of valid cognition is not [the result], because it has already been refuted earlier.

original: de gang yin zhe na de yang ngo //
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na de yang ngo //
translated: What is that? That is also [the result].

original: dgag bya'i rgyu'am rang bzhin de khyab par byed pa snang bar 'dod ba snang med nyid de mi dmigs ba nyid do //
analyzed: dgag bya'i rgyu'am rang bzhin de khyab par byed pa snang bar 'dod ba snang med nyid de mi dmigs ba nyid do //
translated: The cause or nature of the object of negation is the pervader, and the absence of appearance is asserted to be the non-observation of that.

original: ci'i phyir 'di tsam nyid mi dmigs pa nyid ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di tsam nyid mi dmigs pa nyid ce na /
translated: Why is it just this non-observation?

original: yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: Again is stated.

original: rgyu la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The cause and so forth are also.

original: gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Other refers to non-causes and so forth.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi rung ba'o //
translated: In another way means inappropriately.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa la sogs pa med pa la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa la sogs pa med pa la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of ascertaining the absence of the pervader and so forth.

original: mi dmigs pa la sogs pa de dag gis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la sogs pa de dag gis bskyed pa'o //
translated: Those are produced by non-observation and so forth.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus means because of non-deception.

original: des ni rtags can gyi shes pas so //
analyzed: des ni rtags can gyi shes pas so //
translated: That is by the cognition of the reason.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni kha dog la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni kha dog la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bar ro //
translated: Thus means that color and so forth are impermanent.

original: des na mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni dngos po'i chos ma yin na /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni dngos po'i chos ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if impermanence and so forth are not the qualities of things,

original: 'dis ni mi rtag pa nyid kha dog gi spyi la sbyor ba'i phyir na mi rtag pa nyid dngos @140b po'i chos ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni gang yin pa de spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi rtag pa nyid kha dog gi spyi la sbyor ba'i phyir na mi rtag pa nyid dngos @140b po'i chos ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni gang yin pa de spangs pa yin no //
translated: This passage refutes the claim that impermanence is not a real, objective phenomenon because it is applied to the universal of color.

original: gal te dngos po med ngo bo yin te //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med ngo bo yin te //
translated: If it is an entity that has the nature of nonexistence,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid grub par grub phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid grub par grub phyir ro //
translated: then it is established as having an established nature.

original: zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pas dang / mngon sum gyi rjes las 'byung ba'i shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya bas rjes su dpag pas dang / mngon sum gyi rjes las 'byung ba'i shes pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Doesn’t this passage teach that inference and the knowledge that arises after perception have objects that are specifically characterized?

original: da ni gang la kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni gang la kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //
translated: Now, if you claim that it is because it is applied to the universal of color,

original: zhes brjod la /
analyzed: zhes brjod la /
translated: then what is the point of saying,

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi dang sbyar ba'i kha dog gi spyi snang ba de dang yin snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi dang sbyar ba'i kha dog gi spyi snang ba de dang yin snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: “because it is applied to the universal of impermanence”?

original: gal te kha dog 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ni rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te kha dog 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ni rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The passage, “If this is color,” and so on, is the response to the doubt that this is so.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni lhag par zhen pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin yang dngos po'i 'jug pa la de'i rang bzhin la ma reg pa'i phyir na spyi'i yul can kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni lhag par zhen pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin yang dngos po'i 'jug pa la de'i rang bzhin la ma reg pa'i phyir na spyi'i yul can kho na yin no //
translated: Conceptual thought, although it has a particular as its object, is an apprehender of a universal only, because it does not touch the nature of that particular by over-intellectualizing it.

original: des na rjes su dpag pas mi rtog pa la sogs pa 'dzin na kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di yin par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pas mi rtog pa la sogs pa 'dzin na kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di yin par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, when inference apprehends non-conceptuality, etc., it does so by applying a universal to color. This is the way it is accepted.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas kyang kha dog nyid spyi la mi rtag pa nyid rtog pa yin na chos can gyi de tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin te mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang rjes su dpag pas rtogs na yang thug🔽pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas kyang kha dog nyid spyi la mi rtag pa nyid rtog pa yin na chos can gyi de tshad ma gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin te mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang rjes su dpag pas rtogs na yang thug🔽pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If inference apprehends the universal of impermanence in color, then the subject of that [inference] must be apprehended by another valid cognition, because it is not the object of direct perception, and because there would be an infinite regress if it were apprehended by inference.

original: rnam par dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i mngon sum gyi de ma thag tu kha dog la sogs pa 'di ni mi rtag pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa gang yin pa yang tshad ma gzhan yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i mngon sum gyi de ma thag tu kha dog la sogs pa 'di ni mi rtag pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa gang yin pa yang tshad ma gzhan yin te /
translated: The cognition that arises immediately after the direct perception that is endowed with analysis, thinking “This color, etc. is impermanent,” is also a different valid cognition.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la sbyor ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la sbyor ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: Because it is applied to the specific characteristics.

original: gzhan du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is “Otherwise.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nges par skyes par nus pa'i mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i kha dog nyid la sogs pa la 'di ni sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'dzin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: nges par skyes par nus pa'i mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i kha dog nyid la sogs pa la 'di ni sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'dzin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the conceptual cognition that apprehends color, etc. that is apprehended by the direct perception that is capable of generating ascertainment, thinking “This is blue,” etc.

original: de ni tshad ma gzhan nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma gzhan nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: is not asserted to be a different valid cognition.

original: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni rang dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni rang dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the first half of the verse is “because of its own.”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kha dog nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kha dog nyid de /
translated: The specific characteristic is not an object of expression, but the general characteristic is color itself.

original: rnam pa de dag tu kha dog la sogs pa mngon sum gyis bzung zhing ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag tu kha dog la sogs pa mngon sum gyis bzung zhing ngo //
translated: Those aspects are apprehended by direct perception as color, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
translated: Another aspect of this is stated:

original: mi rtag pa nyid du yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “and also impermanence.”

original: mngon sum gyis bzung nas so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bzung nas so //
translated: Having grasped it by direct perception,

original: 'di tsam gyis ni dang por yod pa'i tshad ma'i byed pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni dang por yod pa'i tshad ma'i byed pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This much shows the operation of the valid cognition that first ascertains the existence of color, etc.🔽Then, it is stated that the mind connects it:

original: de'i 'og tu yid kyis mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /🔽kha dog la sogs pa @141a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yid kyis mtshams sbyor bar byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni / kha dog la sogs pa @141a * //
translated: “The mind connects it to impermanence.”

original: mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mind connects it to impermanence.

original: yid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyod pa'i blo can la ltos te /
analyzed: yid kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyod pa'i blo can la ltos te /
translated: “By the mind” is said with reference to those who are intelligent and have analyzed;

original: mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba dang / blo dman pa la ltos te de ni rjes su dpag pa las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba dang / blo dman pa la ltos te de ni rjes su dpag pa las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “after direct perception” means that it is inference for those who are less intelligent.

original: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi glang pos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi glang pos so //
translated: “The master” is Dignāga.

original: tshad mar thal ba ni dgag par 'os pa yin pa des na thal ba brjod pa ni kha dog gi spyi la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad mar thal ba ni dgag par 'os pa yin pa des na thal ba brjod pa ni kha dog gi spyi la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is proper to refute the absurd conclusion that there would be another valid cognition, the statement of the absurd conclusion is “the universal of color.”

original: de ltar tshad ma gzhan yod par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma gzhan yod par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that another valid cognition would exist,

original: chos can spyir thug pa med par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: chos can spyir thug pa med par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since the subject would be generally indeterminate,

original: rjes su dpag pas ni mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni mi 'dzin to //
translated: it is not apprehended by inference.

original: mngon sum gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by direct perception,

original: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽des na de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad mar gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro // des na de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad mar gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: because it is not the object of that.🔽Therefore, it is said that the cognition that has that as its object would be a valid cognition in regard to something else.

original: chos can gyi de zhes bya ba'o rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa tshad ma gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos can gyi de zhes bya ba'o rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa tshad ma gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that it follows that the conceptual cognition would be a valid cognition in regard to something else is in regard to the phrase “the subject that.”

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement “when” is in regard to the phrase “at that time.”

original: thal zin pa'i rtsod pa gnyis ka la yang ngo //
analyzed: thal zin pa'i rtsod pa gnyis ka la yang ngo //
translated: Both of these are objections that have already been raised.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa la'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa la'o //
translated: The phrase “in regard to that” is in regard to conceptual cognition.

original: gal te re zhig kha dog la sogs pa gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis 'grub par 'gyur ba min na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig kha dog la sogs pa gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ni dngos po yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis 'grub par 'gyur ba min na /
translated: If, on the one hand, color and so on and taste and so on are established by direct perception because they are things,

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid des 'grub par ji ltar 'gyur snyam nas brjod pa ni mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid des 'grub par ji ltar 'gyur snyam nas brjod pa ni mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is: “Impermanence.”

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “Thus” means “in response.”

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po las mi rtag pa nyid gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po las mi rtag pa nyid gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence does not exist separately from things such as blue,

original: tha ma'i skad cig mthong ba na tha dad par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha ma'i skad cig mthong ba na tha dad par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the final moment is seen, it is ascertained as distinct.

original: sngar yang dngos po dmigs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi snying po can yin te /
analyzed: sngar yang dngos po dmigs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi snying po can yin te /
translated: Previously, when a thing is observed, it has the essence of impermanence,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: because it is not distinct.

original: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is: “That also.”

original: sngar zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa stos nas so //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa stos nas so //
translated: “Previously” is a conceptual distinction.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid kha la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid kha la sogs pa las tha dad pa ma yin na /
translated: If impermanence is not distinct from things such as blue,

original: de'i tshe brjod ces par bya ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe brjod ces par bya ba tha dad pa med pa'i phyir kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: At that time, since the objects of expression are not different, it would not be the same basis to say “the impermanence of color, etc.”🔽However, it would be a synonym.

original: 'on kyang rnam grangs par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /🔽du ma'i dngos de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam grangs par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni / du ma'i dngos de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this qualm is stated:🔽“That many things are . . .”

original: brjod par bya ba tha dad pa ldog pa tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir te nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba tha dad pa ldog pa tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir te nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the objects of expression are the basis for the difference of the negations, this fault does not exist. This is the meaning.

original: gal te thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir na dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar spyi yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gal te thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir na dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar spyi yin zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: If it is asked, “How is the nature of things a generality because it is not shared?”🔽The response is stated:

original: rnam par rtog pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: “By conception . . .”

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin @141b nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin @141b nyid do //
translated: “That itself” is the nature of things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin par mi nus pa de'i phyir na rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin par mi nus pa de'i phyir na rang bzhin no //
translated: Because conception cannot apprehend the nature of things. Therefore it is a nature.

original: de bas na spyi ni 'dzin pa'i byed pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na spyi ni 'dzin pa'i byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the universal is the agent of apprehension.

original: dngos po las gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: dngos po las gzhan ni med do //
translated: Therefore, the universal is not a different entity from the thing.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa la spyi tha dad par snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa la spyi tha dad par snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the universal does not appear as different from the conceptual cognition,

original: des na gzhan ni med do zhes ji ltar brjod snyam na /
analyzed: des na gzhan ni med do zhes ji ltar brjod snyam na /
translated: how can it be said that it is not different?

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is:

original: mngon sum las snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum las snang ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the nature of what appears in perception is

original: 'di ni sngon po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “This is blue.”

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: “In that” refers to the particular.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sngon po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sngon po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Thus” is to be supplied with “This is blue.”

original: mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba'i spyi nyid rnam par rtog pas 'dzin pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba'i spyi nyid rnam par rtog pas 'dzin pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating the doubt that the universal itself, which is not grasped by perception, is grasped by conceptual cognition,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the response is:🔽“But if it is said that the universal is not different from the particular,🔽the response is the same as before.”

original: 'dir yang lan 'di nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang lan 'di nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The response is:

original: de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That is not tenable.”

original: de ni rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pas so //
translated: That is by conceptual cognition.

original: gal te spyi med par tha snyad 'dir ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te spyi med par tha snyad 'dir ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, “How can there be a convention without a universal?”

original: tha snyad kyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: [The root text] says, “conventionally.”

original: gal te zhes bya bas don dam pa'i du ma nyid du dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya bas don dam pa'i du ma nyid du dogs pa'o //
translated: The word “if” expresses the doubt that there is ultimate multiplicity.🔽In order to answer that, [the root text] says, “That is not the ultimate,” and so forth.

original: de ni don dam pa ma yin zhes lan 'debs pa'i don du rang gi mtshan nyid ni re zhig brjod par bya ba ma yin na zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ni don dam pa ma yin zhes lan 'debs pa'i don du rang gi mtshan nyid ni re zhig brjod par bya ba ma yin na zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: [The root text] says, “The own characteristic is not, to begin with, an object of expression.”

original: 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the expression.

original: brjod par bya ba nyid ni brtags pa'i tha dad pa min no zhes brjod pa ni tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid ni brtags pa'i tha dad pa min no zhes brjod pa ni tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression is not a different conceptual distinction.

original: yang na don dam pa'i chos tha dad pa med par rnam par rtog pa tha dad par ji ltar snyam na /
analyzed: yang na don dam pa'i chos tha dad pa med par rnam par rtog pa tha dad par ji ltar snyam na /
translated: Or else, if one thinks, “How can there be a conceptual distinction without a distinction in ultimate phenomena?”

original: tha dad na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [The root text] says, “If there were a distinction.”

original: ji ltar thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu can yin snyam na rnam par rtog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu can yin snyam na rnam par rtog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks, “How can it be the cause of beginningless latent propensities?” [The root text] says, “Conceptualization.”

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i spyi la gzhi mthun pa yin pa de ci ltar na rnam par rtog par gzung ba 'dzin par 'gyur snyam na bshad pa spyi'i chos kyi rten dang de las ldog pa'i dngos po de nges pa bskyed par nus pa'i mngon sum gyis
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i spyi la gzhi mthun pa yin pa de ci ltar na rnam par rtog par gzung ba 'dzin par 'gyur snyam na bshad pa spyi'i chos kyi rten dang de las ldog pa'i dngos po de nges pa bskyed par nus pa'i mngon sum gyis
translated: If one thinks, “How could a common locus be a universal that is apprehended by a conceptual consciousness?”

original: grub pa na spyi de nyid ni grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: grub pa na spyi de nyid ni grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: The direct perception that is able to generate ascertainment of the object that is the basis of the property of the universal and the object that is the opposite of that is established.

original: skad cig ma mthong ba rnams kyis nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma mthong ba rnams kyis nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The universal itself is established because it is ascertained by those who see the instants.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa gzung ba 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa gzung ba 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore the meaning of “apprehending the universal” is apprehending the object that is the basis of the universal.

original: 'o na te des stong pa'i don mthong yang gal te tha ma'i skad cig mthong spangs yin pas mi nges na de nges par byed pa'i don rjes su dpag par 'dod par bya dgos so zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na te des stong pa'i don mthong yang gal te tha ma'i skad cig mthong spangs yin pas mi nges na de nges par byed pa'i don rjes su dpag par 'dod par bya dgos so zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If one sees the object that is empty of that universal but does not ascertain it because the final instant is not seen, then one must desire to infer the object that ascertains it.

original: de ma grub pa zhes bya ba ste spyi ste ma grub na ni de ltar de rgyu mtshan rab tu bstan pas rab tu grub phyir zhes bya ba dngos po rab tu grub pa'i phyir ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ma grub pa zhes bya ba ste spyi ste ma grub na ni de ltar de rgyu mtshan rab tu bstan pas rab tu grub phyir zhes bya ba dngos po rab tu grub pa'i phyir ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word non-established is a general term. If it is a general term, then it is not established in that way, because it is well-established by the teaching of the reason. It is not because of the establishment of the entity that it is well-established.

original: phyed snga ma @142a * //
analyzed: phyed snga ma @142a * //
translated: The first half

original: 'chad pa ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is explained as general term.

original: gzhi mthun par zhes bya ba ni sbra mi rtag pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gzhi mthun par zhes bya ba ni sbra mi rtag pa'o zhes so //
translated: In common means impermanence of substance.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha dad par te sgra'i mi rtag  pa'o zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhi tha dad par te sgra'i mi rtag  pa'o zhes bya bar ro //
translated: Elsewhere means in a different basis, as impermanence of sound.

original: tha snyad ma grub na ni zhes bya ba ni phyid phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad ma grub na ni zhes bya ba ni phyid phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: If the convention is not established explains the second half.

original: tha snyed yul gyi dngos po nyid du dran par byed pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: tha snyed yul gyi dngos po nyid du dran par byed pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is connected as it causes recollection of the entity that is the object of the convention.

original: ji ltar zhe na rgyu mtshan dran pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na rgyu mtshan dran pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: How is it so? By means of the recollection of the reason.

original: ji ltar rgyu mtshan bstan pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu mtshan bstan pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By the teaching of the reason is as it is said.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po nyid do //
translated: It is not otherwise means it is the entity itself.

original: gal te mthong ba'i dngos po la de'i rnam par rtog pa tha snyad sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i dngos po la de'i rnam par rtog pa tha snyad sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If the conceptual thought of an object that is seen establishes a convention,

original: 'di lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir na ba lang ngo zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir na ba lang ngo zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: then it is like saying, “This is a cow because it has a dewlap, etc.”

original: 'di me dang ldan pa yin te de du ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di me dang ldan pa yin te de du ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like saying, “This has fire because it has smoke,”🔽because the presence of fire is not seen.

original: me dang ldan pa nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: me dang ldan pa nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir zhes dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is expressed by “if.”

original: 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa la ni dngos po ma mthong ba nyid kyis tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa la ni dngos po ma mthong ba nyid kyis tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: In the case of inference from an effect, it is said that the establishment of a convention is by the mere non-seeing of an object.

original: de yang mi 'thad de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not tenable, he says.

original: de nyid la ni zhes bya ba rjes dpag rtogs pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la ni zhes bya ba rjes dpag rtogs pa nyid la'o //
translated: “In that very case” means in the very case of the understanding of inference.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: “If” is explained as follows.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa bdag nyid thams cad kyis dngos po ma mthong ba nyid kyis tha snyed sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa bdag nyid thams cad kyis dngos po ma mthong ba nyid kyis tha snyed sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If you say that inference proves the existence of an entity by the non-perception of the whole of itself,

original: de gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then that is not so, as will be stated.

original: rung ba'i rgyu las zhes bya ba ni dpe gsum brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i rgyu las zhes bya ba ni dpe gsum brjod pa'o //
translated: “From a suitable cause” refers to the three examples.

original: don gsum brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don gsum brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The statement of the three meanings is “In that case, etc.”

original: dper na tshogs pa'i dbang gis rung ba'i skyes pa'i rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de bzhin du rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i sngon bdag nyid thams cad kyis dngos po 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na tshogs pa'i dbang gis rung ba'i skyes pa'i rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de bzhin du rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i sngon bdag nyid thams cad kyis dngos po 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: For example, a suitable cause of a sprout by the power of the assemblage necessarily produces an effect. In the same way, an entity that is born from its own cause is apprehended by the whole of itself.

original: ji ltar rgyu med pas 'bras bu mi skye bas de bzhin du de med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu med pas 'bras bu mi skye bas de bzhin du de med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as an effect is not produced by a non-cause, in the same way, by the non-existence of that, inference is apprehended by the whole of itself.

original: yang dper na me grang ba zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag par bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba de dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dper na me grang ba zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag par bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba de dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: For example, “fire is cold” contradicts valid cognition. Likewise, “inference apprehends all objects” contradicts that.

original: tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because another valid cognition engages.

original: tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it relies on another valid cognition.

original: mi srid pa dang 'gal ba khas len na ni rjes dpag pa dngos po mi 'dzin to zhes rang nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi srid pa dang 'gal ba khas len na ni rjes dpag pa dngos po mi 'dzin to zhes rang nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: If you accept that it is impossible and contradictory, you yourself accept that inference does not apprehend objects.

original: zhes lan brjod pa ni 'di ni @142b zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes lan brjod pa ni 'di ni @142b zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the response.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin pa mi srid pa dang / tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa ni mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin na dngos po 'dzin pa gang las yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang bdag nyid thams cad 'dzin pa mi srid pa dang / tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa ni mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yin na dngos po 'dzin pa gang las yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is impossible for inference to apprehend all objects and for another valid cognition to engage. These are contradictory characteristics. How could it apprehend objects? It could not!

original: 'on te de lta yang dngos po 'dzin par 'dod na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te de lta yang dngos po 'dzin par 'dod na de'i tshe /
translated: But if you still assert that it apprehends objects, then

original: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa 'di gnyis gcig gi yin par thal na 'gal ba dang ldan pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa 'di gnyis gcig gi yin par thal na 'gal ba dang ldan pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If it follows that these two, the apprehended and the non-apprehended, belong to one and the same, then it is not logical that they possess contradiction.

original: phyed snga ma bshad nas phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: phyed snga ma bshad nas phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni /
translated: Having explained the first half, he explains the second half:

original: de 'dzin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it apprehends that,

original: mi nges na de dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par mi 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi nges na de dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par mi 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: then, if it is not ascertained, how could it not apprehend the difference that is not different from that?

original: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not?

original: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: At that very time,

original: gzugs par rtogs pa mi 'thad pa nyid brjod nas /
analyzed: gzugs par rtogs pa mi 'thad pa nyid brjod nas /
translated: having stated that the realization of form is untenable,

original: 'dzin par rtogs pa gsungs pa ni de bzhin du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par rtogs pa gsungs pa ni de bzhin du bya ba'o //
translated: the realization of apprehension is stated as follows:

original: me'i khyad par las ma rtogs pa de nyid ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: me'i khyad par las ma rtogs pa de nyid ni yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The non-realization of that from the particular of fire is not existent,

original: de mi 'dzin pa thams cad mi 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de mi 'dzin pa thams cad mi 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: because the non-apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of all.

original: des na gcig la 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig la 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, apprehension and non-apprehension in one is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tha snyad sgrub par byed pa nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tha snyad sgrub par byed pa nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that inference is just the establishment of convention.

original: gal te rtags med la mi 'khrul ba zhes bya ba de 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin gyi rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rtags med la mi 'khrul ba zhes bya ba de 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin gyi rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the reason is not a cause of the apprehension of the universal, but is a cause of the apprehension of the non-erroneous,

original: de mi 'dzin pa thams cad mi 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /🔽'khrul ba phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni ci ste 'du snyam du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de mi 'dzin pa thams cad mi 'dzin pa ni ma yin te / 'khrul ba phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni ci ste 'du snyam du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not the case that the apprehension of the universal is the apprehension of all aspects, and it is not the case that the non-apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of all.🔽If you fear that, then what is the point of saying that the reason is not a cause of the apprehension of the universal?

original: phyir rgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyir rgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not a cause of the apprehension of the universal,

original: lo ma las byung ba la sogs pa khyad par rab tu 'grub par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo ma las byung ba la sogs pa khyad par rab tu 'grub par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the distinction of the universal as arising from leaves and so on would not be established.

original: ci'i phyir 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would it not be established?

original: 'khrul phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is erroneous.

original: de gnyis ga las she na /
analyzed: de gnyis ga las she na /
translated: From what two?

original: spyi la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: spyi la zhes gsungs te /
translated: From the universal.

original: gsal ba thams cad la thun mong du gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal ba thams cad la thun mong du gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is common to all instances.

original: de lta yin na rjes su dpag pa de dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni gal te de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na rjes su dpag pa de dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni gal te de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then the response that inference does not apprehend things is, “If that is so, then…”

original: de'i tshe ji ltar khyad par 'dzin pa yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar khyad par 'dzin pa yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: At that time, how could it apprehend a distinction? It could not!

original: khyad par 'dzin pa nyid yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par 'dzin pa nyid yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it does apprehend a distinction,🔽then it is this:

original: 'di na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Here.”

original: 'o na ci zhig rtogs zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig rtogs zhe na /
translated: What is it that is understood?

original: me tsam zhes smos so /
analyzed: me tsam zhes smos so /
translated: “Fire alone.”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar khyab par 'dzin pa min pa des na dngos po 'dzin nam yin no zhes brjod pa ni sngar du ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar khyab par 'dzin pa min pa des na dngos po 'dzin nam yin no zhes brjod pa ni sngar du ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it does not apprehend in this way, it does not apprehend a thing.

original: gal te khyad par gyi the tshom yod kyang rjes su dpag pa dngos po la dge ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gyi the tshom yod kyang rjes su dpag pa dngos po la dge ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If there is doubt about the distinction, but inference is still a valid cognition,

original: mngon sum du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum du zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is “direct perception.”

original: mngon sum bzhin du dngos po la reg pa yin na rjes su dpag pa la yang khyad par la the tshom za ba yod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du dngos po la reg pa yin na rjes su dpag pa la yang khyad par la the tshom za ba yod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were to touch a thing, like direct perception, then there would be no doubt about the distinction in inference.

original: yod pa ma @143a * //
analyzed: yod pa ma @143a * //
translated: But it does not exist.

original: yin te des na dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin te des na dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it does not apprehend a thing.

original: thob pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas the tshom mi srid par dogs pa ni the tshom za na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas the tshom mi srid par dogs pa ni the tshom za na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that is feared because it is not tenable that there is attainment elsewhere is “if there is doubt.

original: the tshom ni thob pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni thob pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni thob pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni thob pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ” The reply that doubt is not incompatible with attainment is “attainment.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni skabs nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni skabs nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: ” “ Therefore” is a summary of the topic.

original: rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba rtsod pa'o //
translated: The dispute is “by nature.🔽” The reply is “the meaning.

original: lan du don ni zhes bya ba 'o na ji ltar thob ce na kun tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du don ni zhes bya ba 'o na ji ltar thob ce na kun tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ” “ How is there attainment?” “ At all times.

original: gang gis 'thob pa dngos po ma bzung bar der 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'thob pa dngos po ma bzung bar der 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: ” “ How can there be engagement in that without apprehending the entity by which there is attainment?”

original: 'khrus pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrus pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Even by washing.

original: de don don gnyer rnams ni don du gnyer ba rnams so //
analyzed: de don don gnyer rnams ni don du gnyer ba rnams so //
translated: ” “ Those who seek the meaning are those who seek the meaning.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni skra shad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rab rim can gyis dmigs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni skra shad la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rab rim can gyis dmigs pa dag la'o //
translated: ” “ That itself is clarified by ‘such as floating hair’ is in regard to the successive observations.

original: kun tshe yod pa las zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni gang du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun tshe yod pa las zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni gang du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ” “ At all times from the existent” is the commentary on “where.🔽”

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir na thams cad du 'jug pa'i yul 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni mngon sum dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir na thams cad du 'jug pa'i yul 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni mngon sum dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the object that is being entered is apprehended. This is the meaning of “direct perception.”

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “Being entered” is a future tense.

original: rang bzhin gyis bstan gyi gtan tshigs la sogs pa dag tu ni dngos po 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid du 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bstan gyi gtan tshigs la sogs pa dag tu ni dngos po 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid du 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The nature of a thing that is being entered is apprehended in the proofs, etc.

original: des na ma bzung ba thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na ma bzung ba thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that what is not apprehended is obtained. This is the meaning.

original: lan ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyis ni 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyis ni 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The reply is: It is not apprehended by the nature of being entered.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na de ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na de ltar zhes smos so //
translated: Why is that? It is said: “because of that.”

original: 'byung bar gyur pa nyid du dngos po la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur pa nyid du dngos po la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the realization of the thing as being entered.

original: de'i rang bzhin du rtogs na yang skyon yod do zhes brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du rtogs na yang skyon yod do zhes brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if it is realized as having that nature, there is a fault. This is what is said by “if that is so.”

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i dus na da ltar byung ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i dus na da ltar byung ba nyid du'o //
translated: “Otherwise” means that at the time of obtaining, it would be present.

original: de'i tshe yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, it is understood that it will occur.

original: spyi'i yul can nyid kyis dngos po 'dzin par dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can nyid kyis dngos po 'dzin par dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that it apprehends things in general is stated in “If it is said. . . .”

original: de lta na 'o na ma rtogs pa'i khyad par ji ltar 'thob ces brjod pa ni spyi rtogs pa na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ma rtogs pa'i khyad par ji ltar 'thob ces brjod pa ni spyi rtogs pa na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, how is the distinction of non-understanding obtained?

original: thob pa'i rgyu mtshan dogs par byed pa ni yod pa'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽ji ltar gzhan rtogs pa ni gzhan yod snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyu mtshan dogs par byed pa ni yod pa'i zhes bya ba'o // ji ltar gzhan rtogs pa ni gzhan yod snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for the doubt is stated in “If it is said that the universal is understood. . . .”🔽How is the understanding of the other?

original: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “If it is said that the other exists. . . .”

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni rtags nyid las so //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni rtags nyid las so //
translated: “From that alone” means from the reason alone.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: “The other” refers to the objection.

original: spyi yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: spyi yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “The universal” refers to the answer.

original: des na brgyal zhing brtag pa mtshungs kyang gcig la ni brgal zhing @143b brtag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: des na brgyal zhing brtag pa mtshungs kyang gcig la ni brgal zhing @143b brtag par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, although the objection and the analysis are the same, in one case the objection and the analysis are to be applied,

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the principle here?

original: gang gis brtag cing brgal ba mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis brtag cing brgal ba mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ba /
translated: By what means is the question and the objection the same?

original: du ba bzhin du tha dad ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes dogs par byed pa ni gal te spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ba bzhin du tha dad ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes dogs par byed pa ni gal te spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is only that it is not different, like smoke.

original: gal te gzhan kho nar gcig tu nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gzhan kho nar gcig tu nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If the universal is not different from the particular,

original: 'on kyang gzhan ma yin pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan ma yin pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: then the universal is not different from the particular.🔽If the universal is not different from the particular, then the universal is the particular.

original: de'i tshe spyi ni gzung ba dang de nyid ces bya ba spyi gzung ba nyid don ni gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe spyi ni gzung ba dang de nyid ces bya ba spyi gzung ba nyid don ni gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the universal is the particular, then the universal is apprehended.

original: de lta yin na ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ci yod snyam na /
translated: If that is so, what is the problem?

original: de lta yin na zhes gsungs te don bzung ba yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes gsungs te don bzung ba yin na'o //
translated: If that is so, if the particular is apprehended,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: gzung ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzung ba zhes smos so //
translated: Because it is said to be apprehended.

original: de'i the tshom mo //
analyzed: de'i the tshom mo //
translated: That is the doubt.

original: spyi'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: The doubt is stated in the phrase “by the method of the universal.”

original: khyad par gyi rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is stated in the phrase “from the nature of the particular.”

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
