translated: The doubt is stated in the phrase “that also.”

original: khyad par gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the distinction.

original: ci'i don du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ci'i don du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: Why? is the question.

original: mngon par 'dod pa grub zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa grub zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: Because the desired result has already been accomplished, is the answer.

original: 'ga' zhig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: But not by any means, is the nature of the distinction.

original: phyogs 'di gnyis ka la yang yod pa dang mi nus pa'i skyon rim pa bzhin brjod par ni tshul gang gis zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyogs 'di gnyis ka la yang yod pa dang mi nus pa'i skyon rim pa bzhin brjod par ni tshul gang gis zhes sbyar ro //
translated: In both cases, the fault of impossibility is stated in order.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: By what method?

original: mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is impossible.

original: khyod kyi 'dod pas ni ma shes pa la 'jug par nus pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'dod pas ni ma shes pa la 'jug par nus pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: By your assertion, there is no one who can engage in the unknown.

original: the tshom las 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom las 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that one engages through doubt,

original: spyi shes pa la ni the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: spyi shes pa la ni the tshom mi za'o //
translated: then one would not doubt the knowledge of the universal.

original: 'o na mi shes pa la the tshom gyis 'jug pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na mi shes pa la the tshom gyis 'jug pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that one engages in the unknown through doubt,

original: bshad pa khyad par gyi rang bzhin ma shes pa la yang the tshom za ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bshad pa khyad par gyi rang bzhin ma shes pa la yang the tshom za ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: then the explanation is connected: One would not doubt the unknown, which is the nature of the distinction.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is there clinging?

original: the tshom ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: the tshom ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “Doubt is . . . ”

original: gzhan gyi ltar na ni the tshom yang dngos po la reg pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ltar na ni the tshom yang dngos po la reg pa yin te /
translated: According to another interpretation, doubt also touches the object,

original: des na dngos po'i gnas lugs kyi khyad par ma rtogs pas na de la zhen pa'i the tshom du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po'i gnas lugs kyi khyad par ma rtogs pas na de la zhen pa'i the tshom du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is not doubt about the object if one does not understand the special nature of the object.

original: rtogs pa la yang the tshom yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa la yang the tshom yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Doubt does not exist in understanding,

original: gnyis ka yang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both the object and the subject are understood.

original: de'i phyir the tshom las 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom las 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement “one enters through doubt” is not a correct interpretation.

original: rtogs pa'i spyi la 'jug pa nyid ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i na ma rtogs pa'i khyad par la yang 'jug pa yin gyi the tshom las ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i spyi la 'jug pa nyid ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i na ma rtogs pa'i khyad par la yang 'jug pa yin gyi the tshom las ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: One enters into the general understanding of the object, and one also enters into the special understanding of the object, which is not different from the general understanding. One does not enter through doubt.

original: gal te spyi dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te spyi dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the objection that “if one enters through the general understanding of the object, one does not enter into the special understanding of the object” is stated in the line, “If the object is a universal . . . ”

original: khyod kyi lugs kyis yul du ma byas pa la 'jug pa mi 'thad do zhes lan brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs kyis yul du ma byas pa la 'jug pa mi 'thad do zhes lan brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the objection that “it is not tenable that one enters into that which is not an object” is stated in the line, “It is not the case that . . . ”

original: ngo bo gcig pa'i @144a * //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa'i @144a * //
translated: The essence of the two is the same.🔽

original: phyir zhes bya ba yang ma grub ces brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba yang ma grub ces brjod pa ni /
translated: “Because of being of the same nature” is also unestablished.

original: rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by “realization.”

original: rtogs pa ni spyi'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni spyi'o //
translated: Realization is the general case.

original: ma rtogs pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: Non-realization is the specific case.

original: ji ltar de gnyis gcig ma yin par brjod snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis gcig ma yin par brjod snyam na /
translated: How is it that these two are said not to be the same?

original: sngar bshad zin pa dran par byed pa ni shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad zin pa dran par byed pa ni shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The memory of what was previously explained is called “knowledge.”

original: spyi dang khyad par dag la rang bzhin gcig nyid kyis rtogs pa'i skyes bu ni de dag gis gcig nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba yin gyi gnyis ka ma rtogs par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dag la rang bzhin gcig nyid kyis rtogs pa'i skyes bu ni de dag gis gcig nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba yin gyi gnyis ka ma rtogs par ni ma yin no //
translated: A person who realizes the general and specific cases through the same nature realizes their sameness, but not without realizing both.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na ni khyad par rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na ni khyad par rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: At the time of inference, the specific case is not realized,

original: spyi 'ba' zhig rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa'o //
translated: because only the general case is realized.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la spyi rtogs pas gzhan pa'i dus ni dus gzhan ni der mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i khyad par sngar rtogs pa'i spyi dang gcig tu rtogs pa'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la spyi rtogs pas gzhan pa'i dus ni dus gzhan ni der mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i khyad par sngar rtogs pa'i spyi dang gcig tu rtogs pa'i skyes bu'o //
translated: Or, the time of the other is the time of the other, which is understood as one with the previously understood universal by the understanding of the universal.🔽

original: grub pa'i mthar ni sngon gyi dus su rtogs pa'i spyi dus gzhan du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag med pas ma rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar de dang gcig nyid rtogs zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni sngon gyi dus su rtogs pa'i spyi dus gzhan du mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag med pas ma rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar de dang gcig nyid rtogs zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: But if, by the understanding of the universal, the person understands the other time, i.e., the other moment, as identical with the previously understood universal, then, in the system of the Vaibhāṣikas, the universal which was understood at the previous moment is not understood at the other moment, because direct perception and inference do not exist at that other moment. How can one understand that it is identical with that?

original: dus gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by “at the other moment.”

original: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Already explained” refers to:

original: de dang gcig la tshad med min //
analyzed: de dang gcig la tshad med min //
translated: “The non-apprehension of the measure of that.”

original: zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: “The other moment” refers to that.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i chos nyid yin na chag pa'i bum pa bzhin du rdo rje'i rdo rje ba la sogs pa dag kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i chos nyid yin na chag pa'i bum pa bzhin du rdo rje'i rdo rje ba la sogs pa dag kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: If impermanence is the intrinsic nature of entities, then even a diamond’s diamondness, etc., would be apprehended, just like a broken pot. This is the doubt.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If” refers to that.

original: des pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po'i chos ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po'i chos ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, impermanence is not a property of things.

original: nges pa med kyang de'i ngo bor mi 'gal lo zhes lan gsungs pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa med kyang de'i ngo bor mi 'gal lo zhes lan gsungs pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the objection is that even though there is no certainty, it is not contradictory for it to be of that nature.

original: la lar zhes bya ba ni rdo rje la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: la lar zhes bya ba ni rdo rje la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “ In some cases” refers to a diamond, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid yongs su mi shes te mi nges so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid yongs su mi shes te mi nges so //
translated: “ It” refers to impermanence, which is not known, i.e., not ascertained.

original: 'dra ba gzhan rgyun 'jug par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan rgyun 'jug par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a continuity of other similar moments.

original: rigs mi mthun par skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun par skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not arise as a different type.

original: 'khrul pa yin te des na tha dad pa la nges pa bsal ba med pa'i phyir mthong yang mthong ba kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin te des na tha dad pa la nges pa bsal ba med pa'i phyir mthong yang mthong ba kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is mistaken, and therefore, since there is no elimination of certainty with regard to difference, it is said that even though it is seen, it is seen as just one.

original: tha dad mthong ba med phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad mthong ba med phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: because there is no seeing of difference.

original: dper na sgong gi tha dad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgong gi tha dad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the difference of eggs.

original: rgyu ma byed pa dag ni sgong gcig bstan nas de las gzhan ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu ma byed pa dag ni sgong gcig bstan nas de las gzhan ston par byed do //
translated: Having shown one egg, the cause, they show another.

original: de da kyang tha dad par mthong yang de nyid du rtogs pas mthong ba dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de da kyang tha dad par mthong yang de nyid du rtogs pas mthong ba dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Although they are seen as different, they are understood to be the same, so it is as if they were seen.

original: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not certain.

original: sgong de la sgong gzhan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgong de la sgong gzhan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the egg is understood to be different from the other egg.

original: gal te zhes bya ba nas ci yin zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba nas ci yin zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The argument is from “If” up to “what is it? ”

original: rtsod pa po nyid kyis @144b gal te sgrib par zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskal bar dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: rtsod pa po nyid kyis @144b gal te sgrib par zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskal bar dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: The opponent himself raises the objection beginning with “If it is obscured” and so on.

original: bsgribs pa zhes bya ba zhes lan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pa zhes bya ba zhes lan brjod pa'o //
translated: The reply is “It is obscured. ”

original: ci'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not existent?

original: rang gi ngo bos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said “by its own nature. ”

original: de lta na yang ste khas len na ni gnyi ga yang de 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang ste khas len na ni gnyi ga yang de 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even so, if you accept that, then both are like that. This is expressed by “or else. ”

original: ji ltar gnyi ga bsgribs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyi ga bsgribs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are both obscured?

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said “mutually. ”

original: 'on te sems zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te sems zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, the doubt is “if it is the mind. ”

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “In that case” is the reply.

original: skabs kyi don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyi don ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the point.

original: gal te tha dad par bzung nas bsgribs pa'i don ci yin /
analyzed: gal te tha dad par bzung nas bsgribs pa'i don ci yin /
translated: If one grasps them as different, what is the obscured object?

original: de 'dzin pa med na yang tha dad par mthong ba ma 'khrul par gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa med na yang tha dad par mthong ba ma 'khrul par gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if one does not grasp them, the nonerroneous perception of difference remains.

original: sngon gyi rig pa dang de'i yul med pa'i phyir des ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad kyi gegs byed pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: sngon gyi rig pa dang de'i yul med pa'i phyir des ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad kyi gegs byed pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since there is no prior awareness and its object, it is not a conceptualization. However, since it obstructs the convention of similarity,

original: de ni rnam par rtog pas bsgribs par 'gyur ro zhes lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pas bsgribs par 'gyur ro zhes lan brjod pa ni /
translated: it is said to be obscured by conceptualization.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said here.

original: mthong ba dang blta bar bya ba de tha dad par skye bos mthong ba med do //
analyzed: mthong ba dang blta bar bya ba de tha dad par skye bos mthong ba med do //
translated: People do not see that seeing and the seen arise as different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhig phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhig phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because of nonexistence.

original: 'o na ci mthong snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci mthong snyam na /
translated: If you ask what is seen,

original: rtag pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is permanence.

original: sngar gyi zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The prior is explained.

original: 'o na 'das pa nyid du tha snyad gang gis dgos po //
analyzed: 'o na 'das pa nyid du tha snyad gang gis dgos po //
translated: If you ask what is the purpose of the convention of past,

original: snyam na / tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snyam na / tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that, then “even conventionally” is said.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis ka 'das pa dang / tha snyad kyang rtag pa nyid du byed pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis ka 'das pa dang / tha snyad kyang rtag pa nyid du byed pa des na'o //
translated: Because both are past, and even conventionally, it is made permanent by that.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid kyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid kyi tha snyad do //
translated: “ This” refers to the convention of permanence.

original: gal te mthong ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa yang ji ltar tha snyad byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba bzhin du rnam par rtog pa yang ji ltar tha snyad byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If conceptualization is like seeing, then how is it a convention?

original: phyin ci log tu gsungs so //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be mistaken.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pas so //
translated: “ Therefore” means because of existence.

original: gal te de de lta na yang de mthong ba ji ltar bsgribs te ci yang ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de de lta na yang de mthong ba ji ltar bsgribs te ci yang ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is like that, then how is seeing obscured? Because nothing is done at all.

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Therefore” is said.

original: ji ltar tha snyad med pa yin zhe na gzhan zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar tha snyad med pa yin zhe na gzhan zhes gsungs te /
translated: How is it that there is no convention? “ Other” is said.

original: skad cig phyi ma skad cig snga ma las tha dad par nye bar ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig phyi ma skad cig snga ma las tha dad par nye bar ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the later moment is not indicated as different from the earlier moment.

original: de las ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma las so //
analyzed: de las ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma las so //
translated: “ From that” means from the earlier.

original: gal te mkhas pas sgong la sogs pa tha dad par rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma skyes par ni don gyi rgyu 'gal yang ni tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te mkhas pas sgong la sogs pa tha dad par rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam rigs mthun pa'i skad cig ma skyes par ni don gyi rgyu 'gal yang ni tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: If the wise do not perceive the egg, etc., as different, then the arising of a moment of the same type is not the cause of the object.

original: des de bzhin no //
analyzed: des de bzhin no //
translated: He says, “That is so.”

original: 'dir yang tha dad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang tha dad pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Here, how is it different?

original: rigs mi mthun pa las skyes kyang de dmigs pa brjod pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste mkhas pa lta zhog ste rtags med de rtags med pa kho @145a * //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las skyes kyang de dmigs pa brjod pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste mkhas pa lta zhog ste rtags med de rtags med pa kho @145a * //
translated: Even though it arises from a different type, the statement of its observation is “like that.”

original: nar 'jig rten byis pa'i bar gyi skye bos kyang ngo //
analyzed: nar 'jig rten byis pa'i bar gyi skye bos kyang ngo //
translated: Forget about the wise, even the world, up to the foolish, ordinary beings, do not perceive it as different.

original: phyis 'byung ba dang snga ma 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de ltar mar me la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di'i gnas skabs ma yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba dang snga ma 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de ltar mar me la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di'i gnas skabs ma yin par mthong ngo //
translated: That which arises later is not related to the former. Thus, this thing, such as a lamp, is seen as not abiding.

original: 'jig pa yongs su gcod pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa yongs su gcod pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of destruction is apprehension.

original: 'jig pa dang de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa dag ni don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir des na sgyu ma'i sgong bzhin du 'dir yang tha dad par dmigs pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa dag ni don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir des na sgyu ma'i sgong bzhin du 'dir yang tha dad par dmigs pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: because destruction and its non-occasion are not different things, therefore, just like the illusion, here also, the difference is perceived.

original: phyis 'byung ba dang mi 'brel med de 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de'i tha ma'i skad cig des zhes sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba dang mi 'brel med de 'brel pa med pa gang yin pa de'i tha ma'i skad cig des zhes sbyor ba ni /
translated: The last moment of that which is not related to a subsequent occurrence is not related, and that which is not related is connected with the word “that” in the phrase “by that.”

original: la lar de'i sa mi shes te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par brjod pa nyid kyis don go ba yin no //
analyzed: la lar de'i sa mi shes te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par brjod pa nyid kyis don go ba yin no //
translated: In some cases, the meaning is understood by the expression of a particular, as in the phrase “not knowing that ground.”

original: bkod pa'i rnam 'grel bshad pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bkod pa'i rnam 'grel bshad pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the Exposition of the Layout, the opponent’s position is set forth in the phrase “if you say.”🔽The reply, “because it is ascertained,” is that even the sense consciousness apprehends momentariness.

original: nges par rtogs par byed pas ni dbang po'i shes pas kyang skad cig nyid 'dzin pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges par rtogs par byed pas ni dbang po'i shes pas kyang skad cig nyid 'dzin pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya'o //
translated: “ In this way” is the reply.

original: ci ste yang sgron ma la sogs pa ni de'i gnas skabs kho na yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang sgron ma la sogs pa ni de'i gnas skabs kho na yin te /
translated: But if you say that the lamp and so on are just its occasion,

original: des na skad cig ma nyid ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: des na skad cig ma nyid ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /
translated: then how is momentariness apprehended?

original: sgron ma la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The lamp, etc.

original: 'o na ji ltar de nyid yin no zhes rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de nyid yin no zhes rtogs snyam na /
translated: But how can it be that very thing?

original: de lta mod kyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: But still,

original: 'dri'i zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: 'dri'i zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bos so //
translated: by its own nature.

original: tshogs pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: tshogs pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i sgo nas so //
translated: By the same collection of causes,🔽when it is one,

original: gcig nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni mar me 'bar ba gzhan dang gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni mar me 'bar ba gzhan dang gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that there is no other burning lamp.🔽If it is one, the later lamp, etc. are pointless.

original: gcig yin na mar me la sogs pa phyi ma don med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni gal te de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig yin na mar me la sogs pa phyi ma don med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni gal te de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: If that is so,

original: de la zhes bya ba ni til tshigs ma dang po las gzhan pa'i mar khu la sogs pa don med do //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni til tshigs ma dang po las gzhan pa'i mar khu la sogs pa don med do //
translated: then the oil, wick, etc. are pointless.🔽Because there is no dependence,

original: rag las pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rag las pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is independent.

original: rang dbang ji ltar zhe na grub zin pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dbang ji ltar zhe na grub zin pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it independent? Because it is already established.

original: dus gzhan du gnas par skye nas tshogs pa gzhan don med par brjod nas /
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnas par skye nas tshogs pa gzhan don med par brjod nas /
translated: Having stated that the collection of the lamp, etc. is not without purpose in the production of the non-endurance of another moment,

original: dus gzhan mi gnas par skye ba la ma nus pa med pa brjod pa ni dus gzhan du mi gnas par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan mi gnas par skye ba la ma nus pa med pa brjod pa ni dus gzhan du mi gnas par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says that the non-endurance of another moment is not without purpose in the production of the non-endurance of another moment.

original: tshogs pa gzhan gyis gzhan skyed pa'i phyir ji ltar don med pa yin zhe na bshad pa gzhan skyed nas ni de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan gyis gzhan skyed pa'i phyir ji ltar don med pa yin zhe na bshad pa gzhan skyed nas ni de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: If you ask, “How is the collection of another not without purpose in the production of another?” he says, “Having produced another, it is that itself.”

original: de ltar sgron ma la sogs pa skad cig dang po nyid las dus gzhan du gnas par skyes pa la sgong bu dang ras bal la sogs pa'i tshogs pa med par brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgron ma la sogs pa skad cig dang po nyid las dus gzhan du gnas par skyes pa la sgong bu dang ras bal la sogs pa'i tshogs pa med par brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having stated that the collection of the lamp, etc. is not without purpose in the production of the non-endurance of another moment,

original: mig la sogs pas kyang skad cig dang po nyid la @145b bdag nyid thams cad bzung ba'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa'i mig la sogs pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas kyang skad cig dang po nyid la @145b bdag nyid thams cad bzung ba'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa'i mig la sogs pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says that the subsequent eye, etc. are without purpose because the eye, etc. grasp the entire self in the very first moment.

original: rnam pa 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su dogs pa bsu nas ni 'on te zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su dogs pa bsu nas ni 'on te zhes bya ste /
translated: Anticipating the apprehension of two aspects, he says, “Or, is it the one that exists at another time?”

original: dus gzhan dus gnas pa'i de yin la 'dzin pa'i yin pa de zhes bya ste rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan dus gnas pa'i de yin la 'dzin pa'i yin pa de zhes bya ste rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second conception is, “Is it the one that exists at another time that is apprehended?”

original: lan ni de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is, “If that were so…”

original: mthong ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis 'dzin na'o //
analyzed: mthong ba gzhan dang gzhan gyis 'dzin na'o //
translated: If it were apprehended by another seeing,

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la brjod pa ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la brjod pa ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the second conception is expressed by “apprehension.”

original: cig car tshe na zhes bya ba ni skad cig gcig la'o //
analyzed: cig car tshe na zhes bya ba ni skad cig gcig la'o //
translated: “At the same time” means in one moment.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid du'o //
translated: “In that case” means in the case of permanence.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid 'dzin par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid 'dzin par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that what exists at another time is apprehended, therefore…

original: gal te lan mthong bar gyur pa ni dus yun ring por gyur na /
analyzed: gal te lan mthong bar gyur pa ni dus yun ring por gyur na /
translated: If the response is that the seen object is a long-lasting entity,

original: de'i tshe glog la sogs pa thams cad kyang de ltar 'gyur te /🔽dus ring por 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de'i tshe glog la sogs pa thams cad kyang de ltar 'gyur te / dus ring por 'gyur snyam na /
translated: then in that case everything, lightning and so on, would be like that.

original: mthong ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thinking that, he says, “If it is seen…”

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi lugs kyis brjod par zad kyi 'di 'thad par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi lugs kyis brjod par zad kyi 'di 'thad par ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is merely the assertion of the other party, but it is not correct.

original: ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba phyed phyi ma 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba phyed phyi ma 'chad pa'o //
translated: The second half of the verse explains “just as, just as.

original: phyed snga ma rnam par 'brel pa ni dus gcig nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed snga ma rnam par 'brel pa ni dus gcig nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ” The first half is related to “at the same time.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring por ma mthong bas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring por ma mthong bas na'o //
translated: ” Therefore means because of not seeing for a long time.

original: 'o na ji ltar rmongs snyam na ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rmongs snyam na ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks, “How can there be confusion?,” the response is “If.

original: mthong ba yin yang gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba yin yang gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: ” Even though there is seeing, there is no clarity.🔽The response is that there is no certainty in seeing because the capacity is not different from the thing.

original: mthong ba ma nges par yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni nus pa dngos po las tha mi dad pas bzung bzhin du yang rmongs 'gyur te nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ma nges par yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni nus pa dngos po las tha mi dad pas bzung bzhin du yang rmongs 'gyur te nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though it is apprehended, there is confusion, that is, there is no certainty.

original: gang las zhes nges gsal med phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las zhes nges gsal med phyir ro //
translated: From what? Because there is no clarity.

original: gsal ba med pa nyid ji ltar zhe na 'bras bu mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba med pa nyid ji ltar zhe na 'bras bu mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is there no clarity? Because the effect is not seen.

original: ji ltar mthong ba med snyam na de ma thag med pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba med snyam na de ma thag med pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that it is not seen because it does not exist at the time it is seen, then it is said, “because it does not exist immediately after.”

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid de las tha mi dad pas de bzung bas bzung nyid yin bzhin du yang rmongs pa ni nges pa gsal ba med pa'i phyir de chod pas na skad cig tha ma'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid de las tha mi dad pas de bzung bas bzung nyid yin bzhin du yang rmongs pa ni nges pa gsal ba med pa'i phyir de chod pas na skad cig tha ma'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, because impermanence is not different from that, it is grasped when that is grasped. However, because of the absence of clear ascertainment of the deluded, it is obstructed by that, because the effect of the final moment is not seen.

original: 'di'i rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu rtag tu nye ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba dpe'i don ci shugs kyis 'phags pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i rigs mi mthun pa'i rgyu rtag tu nye ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba dpe'i don ci shugs kyis 'phags pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The cause of the dissimilar type is not always present. The meaning of the example is what is to be understood by implication. To show this, it says:

original: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example.

original: de nyid ces bya ba rmongs pa bzlog pa'i ched du yod pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa brjod pa yin gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin grub pa'i don ni ma @146a * //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba rmongs pa bzlog pa'i ched du yod pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa brjod pa yin gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin grub pa'i don ni ma @146a * //
translated: In order to eliminate confusion about that, it is said that it is momentary. The inference is stated, but the meaning of establishing the nature of things is not stated.

original: yin no // bgoms pa las de'i rang bzhin nye bar mtshon pa'i mthong ba nyid las ni mtha' skad cig mthong ba med kyang nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni blo gros chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yin no // bgoms pa las de'i rang bzhin nye bar mtshon pa'i mthong ba nyid las ni mtha' skad cig mthong ba med kyang nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni blo gros chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: But from the cultivation of the insight that perceives the nature of the momentary, one is certain even without seeing the final moment.

original: gang la blo gros chen po mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang la blo gros chen po mnga' ba'o //
translated: The one who has great intelligence is the one who has great insight.

original: blo gros chen po yang bgoms pa las gsal ba nyid do rnam pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas rnam pa thams cad de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po yang bgoms pa las gsal ba nyid do rnam pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas rnam pa thams cad de /
translated: Great insight is clarity from cultivation.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang stong pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang stong pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: All aspects are all the aspects of impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and emptiness.

original: de dag ni mthong ba nyid las nges par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba nyid las nges par byed do //
translated: One is certain from the insight of those.🔽Because of delusion,

original: des na ni rmongs pas na'o //🔽de'i phyir ni ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na ni rmongs pas na'o // de'i phyir ni ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one is uncertain.🔽Therefore is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba'i skad cig mtshams sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba'i skad cig mtshams sbyor ba la'o //
translated: From what is a summary of the topic.🔽From what is a summary of the topic

original: dngos po gcig gi rjes su 'brang ba yin la ji ltar chos tha dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: dngos po gcig gi rjes su 'brang ba yin la ji ltar chos tha dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is the one entity that is followed, how could it not follow different things?

original: sngon po nyams su myong ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon po nyams su myong ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: [The answer is:] it is said to be the experience of blue.

original: rjes su 'brang ba na yang nges par brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa brtag pa'i yul can du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba na yang nges par brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa brtag pa'i yul can du 'gyur ro ;
translated: And when it follows, it becomes the object of inference that is definitely based on it.

original: /'dod pa tsam las byung ba'i rtogs pas ni thams cad la dka' ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: /'dod pa tsam las byung ba'i rtogs pas ni thams cad la dka' ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that there is no difficulty for anyone in anything, since understanding arises from mere desire.

original: 'di dngos po'i rang bzhin gcig gi rjes su 'brang ba'am /
analyzed: 'di dngos po'i rang bzhin gcig gi rjes su 'brang ba'am /
translated: This is not the case, that it follows one entity's nature,

original: 'dod pa tsam las byung ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dang de las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam las byung ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de dang de las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: or that it arises from mere desire. Rather, it has a reason that turns away from this and that.

original: 'di la lan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the answer to this.

original: de dang de las bzlog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi chos dang nye bar ston par byed pa'i blos ni tha dad pa'i rten can bzhin du rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang de las bzlog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi chos dang nye bar ston par byed pa'i blos ni tha dad pa'i rten can bzhin du rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: The inference is engaged in the same way as the cognition that reveals the property-possessor qualified by the property, which is the reason that is the opposite of that and that.

original: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag tha dad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag tha dad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This states that the probandum and the proof are different.

original: brda yod pa na sgras kyang tha dad pa 'di ni brjod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni ji ltar brtags pa'i sgra zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brda yod pa na sgras kyang tha dad pa 'di ni brjod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni ji ltar brtags pa'i sgra zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When there is a convention, the word also expresses this difference. This is what is meant by the so-called imagined word.

original: gal te dngos po thams cad las ldog pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po thams cad las ldog pa yin na /
translated: If it is the negation of all things,

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig las ldog pa nyid du nges she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig las ldog pa nyid du nges she na /
translated: how is it ascertained as the negation of some?

original: 'khrul rgyu med na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khrul rgyu med na zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “when there is no cause for error.”

original: goms pa bsal ba'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na ni don med rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i blo bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goms pa bsal ba'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na ni don med rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i blo bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to eliminate familiarity, when there is no cause for error, it generates a cognition that accords with the object.

original: skad cig yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not from a nature that is the opposite of being momentary.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of error is possible.

original: des na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa mi 'gal lo zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa mi 'gal lo zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the probandum and probans are not contradictory.

original: rnam par bshad pa yang med bzhin du grang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa yang med bzhin du grang bar bya ba'o //
translated: And the explanation is to be done without explanation.

original: thabs gcig nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi bya @146b ba gcig nyid kyis so //
analyzed: thabs gcig nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi bya @146b ba gcig nyid kyis so //
translated: By means of the very same means, i.e., by means of the very same means which has the nature of apprehension.

original: ji ltar thams cad las ldog pa mi nges te /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad las ldog pa mi nges te /
translated: How is it that the exclusion from everything is not ascertained?

original: nges pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is ascertained just so.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of an inference which proves impermanence, etc.?

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gsungs pa ni 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gsungs pa ni 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for that is stated: because of the possibility of error.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan de bas yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan de bas yin zhe na /
translated: If the cause of error is that,

original: nang gi 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: nang gi 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gsungs pa ni /
translated: the internal cause of error is stated:

original: sngar mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because of the prior perception.

original: gal te sngar mthong ba'i skad cig skad cig phyi ma'i dus na de kho na nyid bzhin du dran par 'gyur na ni mi rtag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te sngar mthong ba'i skad cig skad cig phyi ma'i dus na de kho na nyid bzhin du dran par 'gyur na ni mi rtag pa nyid du nges par gyur pa zhig na /
translated: If the moment of seeing that existed previously were remembered in the same way at a later time, then it would be ascertained as impermanent.

original: de ltar dran pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not remembered in that way.

original: des na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan srid pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan srid pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of error is possible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dran pa nyams pa med na rtag tu ldog pa dran par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dran pa nyams pa med na rtag tu ldog pa dran par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: For that very reason, it is said that if memory is unimpaired, one would always remember cessation.

original: sngar 'di mthong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar 'di mthong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, I saw this before.

original: gal te sngon mthong ba nyid kyis dran pa yin yang ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: gal te sngon mthong ba nyid kyis dran pa yin yang ji ltar nges she na /
translated: Even if it is remembered by what was seen before, how is it ascertained?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said, In this way...

original: gang zhig nyams su myong ba 'di dran pa skye ba 'di nyid ni nyams su myong ba nges pa yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig nyams su myong ba 'di dran pa skye ba 'di nyid ni nyams su myong ba nges pa yin na /
translated: If this memory of what was experienced arises, then that experience is ascertained.

original: de yod na ldog pa las ldog pa mi nges par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de yod na ldog pa las ldog pa mi nges par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it exists, how could cessation be uncertain due to cessation?

original: ji ltar 'di nyid nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this ascertained?

original: bshad pa nyams su myong ba las gzhan du dran pa skye ba gcig tu nges par gyur na phyin ci log yin zhe na /
analyzed: bshad pa nyams su myong ba las gzhan du dran pa skye ba gcig tu nges par gyur na phyin ci log yin zhe na /
translated: If memory arises in a different way than the experience, it is mistaken.

original: log pa nyid du yin no //
analyzed: log pa nyid du yin no //
translated: It is mistaken.

original: dper na smig rgyu dag la chur lhag par zhen pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu dag la chur lhag par zhen pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the over-esteeming of what is not the path in regard to a mirage.

original: nyams su myong ba dang de las bzlog pa dag la nges pa med par dran pa skye ba ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang de las bzlog pa dag la nges pa med par dran pa skye ba ni nges pa yin no //
translated: Memory arises without certainty in regard to experience and its opposite.

original: ldog pa brjod pa ni nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa brjod pa ni nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of the negation is “experience.”

original: rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba brjod pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of the concomitance is “just as it was.”

original: gang gis ldog pa thams cad nges par 'gyur ba ji ltar ni de kho na bzhin dran par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ldog pa thams cad nges par 'gyur ba ji ltar ni de kho na bzhin dran par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be that all negations are certain, and how can it be that memory is just as it was?

original: ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs so //
translated: It is just as it was.

original: des na zhas bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mi srid pas so //
analyzed: des na zhas bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mi srid pas so //
translated: The word “therefore” means that the cause of error is impossible.

original: gal te tshu rol mthong ba rnams la rnam pa gzhan du dran pa 'byung ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te tshu rol mthong ba rnams la rnam pa gzhan du dran pa 'byung ba'i phyir na /
translated: If memory arises in a different way for those who see only a part,

original: ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid du nges she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid du nges she na /
translated: How is it ascertained that it is impermanent?

original: de lta ma yin pa ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa ma mthong ba'o //
translated: It is not seen to be otherwise.

original: de ma thag tu nges par mi byed na ni mi dran pa ste phyin ci log tu dran pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu nges par mi byed na ni mi dran pa ste phyin ci log tu dran pa'o //
translated: If it does not definitely do so immediately, then it is not remembered, but remembered erroneously.

original: de ltar mi rtag pa nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyogs la tshad ma gzhan du thal bar yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //🔽da ni mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyogs la yang thal ba der mi 'gyur ro zhes rang gi phyogs pa dag kho nas brjod pa ni gzhan dag ces bya ba ste mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin du smra @147a *
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag pa nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyogs la tshad ma gzhan du thal bar yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no // da ni mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyogs la yang thal ba der mi 'gyur ro zhes rang gi phyogs pa dag kho nas brjod pa ni gzhan dag ces bya ba ste mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin du smra @147a *
translated: Thus, in the position that impermanence is the intrinsic reality of things, the consequence of another valid cognition does not exist.🔽Now, in the position that impermanence is not the intrinsic reality of things, that consequence does not occur.🔽The opponent himself states:🔽Others say:

original: // ba las gzhan pa'ang gi phyogs pa dag go //
analyzed: // ba las gzhan pa'ang gi phyogs pa dag go //
translated: Those who propound that impermanence is the intrinsic nature of things.

original: ji skad smra zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad smra zhe na /
translated: What do they say?

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or.🔽🔽

original: dngos po nyid mi rtag pa nyid du mngon sum gyis ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po nyid mi rtag pa nyid du mngon sum gyis ma grub pa'am /
translated: impermanence is not established by direct perception as the intrinsic reality of things.

original: 'jig pa gzhan mi rtag pa yin par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'jig pa gzhan mi rtag pa yin par 'gyur mod /
translated: Or, destruction is impermanent.

original: de lta na yang mtha'i skad cig 'dir mi dmigs pa'i rtag pa las 'jig ba grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang mtha'i skad cig 'dir mi dmigs pa'i rtag pa las 'jig ba grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Nevertheless, it is established that destruction occurs from a permanent thing that is not perceived at the final moment.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de ma thag pa ni phyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir na sngar gyi dngos po yang mi rtag pa yin par 'grub po //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de ma thag pa ni phyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir na sngar gyi dngos po yang mi rtag pa yin par 'grub po //
translated: Since the immediately preceding thing that has the characteristic of being perceived is not perceived later, it is established that the previous thing is impermanent.

original: skad cig so sor mi 'jig na mtha'i skad cig la yang rang bzhin de nyid yin te /
analyzed: skad cig so sor mi 'jig na mtha'i skad cig la yang rang bzhin de nyid yin te /
translated: If it did not disintegrate in each moment, it would have that same nature at the final moment.

original: des na sngar bzhin du phyis kyang mi 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sngar bzhin du phyis kyang mi 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like before, it would not disintegrate later.

original: mthar 'jig pa'i phyir na sngar yang 'di de'i chos can kho na yin no zhes nges par byed do //
analyzed: mthar 'jig pa'i phyir na sngar yang 'di de'i chos can kho na yin no zhes nges par byed do //
translated: Since it disintegrates in the end, it is ascertained that it had that nature previously.

original: mi gal ba la ni dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin bzlog zla'i mngon sum las dgag pa 'grub pa yin la de lta na yang tshad ma gzhan du thal ba ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mi gal ba la ni dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin bzlog zla'i mngon sum las dgag pa 'grub pa yin la de lta na yang tshad ma gzhan du thal ba ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: If it were not so, then the negation would be established from the perception of the opposite of the nature of the nonperception of the object of negation. However, it is intended that even so, it would not follow that there would be another valid cognition.

original: 'chad pa ni dngos po thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni dngos po thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is of all things.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par lhag par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par lhag par zhen pa ste /
translated: Direct perception is the ascertainment of the probandum.

original: dgag par lhag par zhen pa ni med par sgrub par byed par mi 'gal pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgag par lhag par zhen pa ni med par sgrub par byed par mi 'gal pa'i phyir te /
translated: The ascertainment of the probandum is not contradictory to the establishment of the non-existence of the probandum,

original: dper na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the perception of something with a contradictory nature is.

original: rigs pa pa'i 'dod pa las 'di khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i don du de'i don du ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa pa'i 'dod pa las 'di khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i don du de'i don du ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show that this [inference] is superior to the Naiyāyikas' assertion, he anticipates an objection with If you say....

original: yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sgrub par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sgrub par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase by a valid cognition that establishes existence means that it is not by non-apprehension, because it is the ascertainment of the probandum.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis ni mi rtag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i ltar na ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis ni mi rtag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i ltar na ste /
translated: It is not impermanent by its mere nature, according to the reasoning of the Naiyāyikas,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang mi rtag pa nyid du thal pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang mi rtag pa nyid du thal pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that even space and so on are impermanent. This is the meaning.

original: 'o na ji ltar mi rtag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mi rtag pa yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Well then, how is it impermanent?

original: 'o na ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase What then? is the response.

original: de lta na yang tshad ma gzhan du thal bar ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshad ma gzhan du thal bar ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can it not follow that it is another valid cognition?

original: dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not a non-thing.

original: rgol ba gzhan gyi ltar na zhes bya ba ni snang byed kyi ltar na'o //
analyzed: rgol ba gzhan gyi ltar na zhes bya ba ni snang byed kyi ltar na'o //
translated: According to the opponent means according to the view of Bhadanta Srilata.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis kyi'o //
translated: The two extremes of the prior limit and the posterior limit means the two characterized by non-existence prior to the cause and non-existence after the cause has ceased.

original: 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba ni yang na 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba ni yang na 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: How is this means how is this?

original: 'di la bshad pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' sma ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' sma ba'o //
translated: The explanation here is the statement of the conclusion.

original: ji ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad ce na /
translated: How is it explained?

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mtha' gnyis @147b kyis chod ba ni /🔽bar chod byed pa'i yod pa'am /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mtha' gnyis @147b kyis chod ba ni / bar chod byed pa'i yod pa'am /
translated: The two extremes characterized by non-existence prior to the cause and non-existence after the cause has ceased are excluded.🔽Existence is excluded in the middle.

original: de dang 'brel pa can mi rtag pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can mi rtag pa yin pa'o //
translated: Or, impermanence is excluded, which is related to that.

original: mi rtag pa ni mtha' gnyis dang ldan pa'i dngos po yin la mi rtag pa'i sgra'i dngos po'i rkyen ni yod pa'am de dang 'brel pa la yin na zhes bya bar 'dod pa'i rgol ba ni des mtha' de dag gang la brjod de dngos po med pa las
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni mtha' gnyis dang ldan pa'i dngos po yin la mi rtag pa'i sgra'i dngos po'i rkyen ni yod pa'am de dang 'brel pa la yin na zhes bya bar 'dod pa'i rgol ba ni des mtha' de dag gang la brjod de dngos po med pa las
translated: If the opponent asserts that it is a thing that is related to existence, then what is the referent of the word?

original: ma gtogs pa gang zhig yin par 'dod pa der khas len pa ni de mi dmigs pas 'dzin gyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa gang zhig yin par 'dod pa der khas len pa ni de mi dmigs pas 'dzin gyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: If the opponent accepts that it is a thing that is related to existence, then it is apprehended by nonapprehension, but not by any other means of knowledge other than direct perception and inference.

original: re zhig ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The word “now” is explained.

original: khyad par med par zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par med do //
analyzed: khyad par med par zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par med do //
translated: Without distinction means without the distinction of the two ends.

original: mi rtag pa dang thal ba'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang thal ba'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: Because of impermanence and because of the consequence.

original: 'o na mi rtag pa nyid gang yin snyam na mtha' gnyis kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na mi rtag pa nyid gang yin snyam na mtha' gnyis kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, what is impermanence? It is the two ends.

original: gal te de lta bur gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bur gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that such impermanence is not established by perception,

original: dngos po med pa ma rtogs pa'i mtha' gnyis nyid ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma rtogs pa'i mtha' gnyis nyid ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: then there is no end to the non-apprehension of non-entities.

original: de lta na yang dngos po med pa mi dmigs pas sgrub par 'gyur gyi mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa sel ba ni gal te zhes bya ba na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po med pa mi dmigs pas sgrub par 'gyur gyi mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no snyam du dogs pa sel ba ni gal te zhes bya ba na'o //
translated: Even so, you might think that non-existence is established by non-apprehension, but not impermanence. To dispel this doubt, he says, “If you say that non-existence is apprehended by non-apprehension, but not impermanence, then that is precisely what we are saying.”

original: dngos po med pa mi dmigs pas 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa mi dmigs pas 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: Non-existence is apprehended by non-apprehension,

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not impermanence.

original: de'i tshe de nyid ces bya ba snga phyir med pa nyid mi rtag ces ma yin te yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid ces bya ba snga phyir med pa nyid mi rtag ces ma yin te yin pa nyid do //
translated: Then, that very non-existence of prior and subsequent is impermanence, not existence.

original: des na nyes pa'i ni med do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na nyes pa'i ni med do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault, he thinks.🔽Or, if existence and its relation are at the time of non-existence,

original: yang na yod pa dang de dang 'brel pa'i dus na ni dngos po med pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: yang na yod pa dang de dang 'brel pa'i dus na ni dngos po med pa kho na yin na /
translated: then non-existence is precisely non-existence.

original: de ji ltar 'di yod pa dang de dang 'brel pa dag gi khyad par du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'di yod pa dang de dang 'brel pa dag gi khyad par du 'gyur /
translated: How could it be a distinction of this thing’s existence and its connection?

original: 'on te dus tha dad pas kyang sngar dang phyis med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dus tha dad pas kyang sngar dang phyis med pa yin no //
translated: But if it is different in time, then it is not nonexistent before and after.

original: dngos po'i dus na ni khyad par blos bsdebs pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po'i dus na ni khyad par blos bsdebs pa yin na /
translated: If it is a distinction added by the mind at the time of the thing,

original: de'i tshe dngos po'i dus na nye bar gzung ba'i dngos po'i med pa nyid mi rtag par ji ste mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po'i dus na nye bar gzung ba'i dngos po'i med pa nyid mi rtag par ji ste mi 'dod de /
translated: then why not accept that the nonexistence of the thing that is apprehended at the time of the thing is impermanence?

original: de nyid mi rtag pa yin mod /
analyzed: de nyid mi rtag pa yin mod /
translated: That itself is impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa 'thad pa med pa gzhan khas blangs pas ci bya /
analyzed: mi rtag pa 'thad pa med pa gzhan khas blangs pas ci bya /
translated: What is the use of accepting another kind of impermanence that is not tenable?

original: 'dod pa la nyes pa dogs par byas /
analyzed: 'dod pa la nyes pa dogs par byas /
translated: The fault in the assertion is stated.

original: sel bar byed pa ni drug pa sogs zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: sel bar byed pa ni drug pa sogs zhes bya bar ro //
translated: The term “and so on” in “exclusion and so on” is used to indicate a class.

original: drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyar ba ni 'brel pas rab tu phye ba yin na /
analyzed: drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyar ba ni 'brel pas rab tu phye ba yin na /
translated: If the application of “and so on” is distinguished by connection,

original: dngos po snga na med pa la sogs pa dang 'du ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po snga na med pa la sogs pa dang 'du ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then there is no connection by the characteristics of the nonexistence of the thing prior to it and so on, and the possession of the connection and so on.

original: 'dra ba dang ldan pa dag ni dngos po kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba dang ldan pa dag ni dngos po kho na'i yin no //
translated: Similarity belongs only to things.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi 'brel pa ni ldan la ltos pas dngos po dag kho na'i yin @148a * //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi 'brel pa ni ldan la ltos pas dngos po dag kho na'i yin @148a * //
translated: The relation of qualifier and qualified is only of entities, because it is dependent on possession.

original: no ; / de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni /
analyzed: no ; / de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni /
translated: Therefore, an entity and a nonentity

original: 'brel pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: have no relation at all.

original: 'brel pa med pa de bas na drug pa dang bdun pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad dang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa de bas na drug pa dang bdun pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad dang mi 'thad do //
translated: Because they have no relation, the distinctions of sixth, seventh, and so on, and the conventions of property and possessor are untenable.

original: drug po la sogs pa'i 'thad pa de bas na med pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: drug po la sogs pa'i 'thad pa de bas na med pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you say, “We do not assert that nonexistence is impermanent because the distinctions of sixth and so on are tenable,”

original: de'i tshe yod pa la sogs pa dang gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa la sogs pa dang gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang rung ste /
translated: then at that time, whether it is existence and so on or something else,

original: bar chod du 'gyur ba'i yod pa zhe'am /
analyzed: bar chod du 'gyur ba'i yod pa zhe'am /
translated: it would be an existent that is an obstruction.

original: de gnyis kyi khyad par can zhes pa de ltar sbyar ba snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa'i mtha' la yang drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi khyad par can zhes pa de ltar sbyar ba snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa'i mtha' la yang drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'am /
translated: Or, if you apply the distinction of those two, the application of sixth and so on would be to the limit of nonexistence prior to existence and to the limit of nonexistence after disintegration.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po de tsam ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po de tsam ltar 'gyur te /
translated: and the qualifier and the qualified would be just like that.

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: But that is not so.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it so that they are not.

original: des na de dang 'dra bar dngos po la yang snga na med pa la sogs pa la ltos nas drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: des na de dang 'dra bar dngos po la yang snga na med pa la sogs pa la ltos nas drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'am /
translated: Therefore, like that, with regard to entities, the application of the sixth case, etc., in dependence on prior non-existence, etc.,

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por 'gyur ba yin no //🔽'gyur ba ni thams cad la 'gyur la mi 'gyur na ni 'gar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por 'gyur ba yin no // 'gyur ba ni thams cad la 'gyur la mi 'gyur na ni 'gar yang ma yin te /
translated: or the relation of qualifier and qualified would be just like that.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa'o //
translated: But it is not so that they are all so, nor is it so that they are not so, because there is no difference.

original: bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bshad pa ni /
translated: The response is:

original: gal te bsam pa 'di yin te //
analyzed: gal te bsam pa 'di yin te //
translated: If this is your thought,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is just as explained.

original: bsam pa gang zhe na /🔽gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa gang zhe na / gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the thought?🔽If,

original: med pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po'i zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: med pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po'i zhes sbyar ro //
translated: if it does not exist, then it is applied to entity.

original: ci'i phyir med par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Why would it not exist?

original: dngos po dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: With entity,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why?

original: dngos po dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: With entity, it is said.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni khyad par can gyi dngos po bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni khyad par can gyi dngos po bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the entity that is qualified.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin snyam na mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin snyam na mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: If you ask, “Why is this so?” the root text states, “Because it is untenable for an entity and a nonentity to be related.”

original: mi 'thad pa yang rnam 'grel bshad pa nyid du gsal bar byas nas yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa yang rnam 'grel bshad pa nyid du gsal bar byas nas yang mi 'dod do //
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of Principles explains that this is untenable, but it is not accepted.

original: ci zhig smras she na /
analyzed: ci zhig smras she na /
translated: What is it that is not accepted?

original: khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” is not accepted.

original: dngos po ni dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir na dngos po'i snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes drug pa la sogs pa'i rgyu sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa ni mi 'thad de 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir na dngos po'i snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes drug pa la sogs pa'i rgyu sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'dod pa ni mi 'thad de 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an entity is not related to a nonentity, the statement “The impermanence that is the prior nonexistence and subsequent nonexistence of an entity is the sixth and other reasonings” is not tenable.

original: 'byung ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bzlog zin to snyam na /
analyzed: 'byung ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bzlog zin to snyam na /
translated: The opponent may think, “The relationship between primary matter and so on has already been refuted.”

original: bzlog med khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yang 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa gang gis zlog par byed cing drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yang gang gis bzlog /'o na khyad par dang khyad par can @148b gyi dngos po yang 'du ba
analyzed: bzlog med khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yang 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa gang gis zlog par byed cing drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yang gang gis bzlog /'o na khyad par dang khyad par can @148b gyi dngos po yang 'du ba
translated: What relation of inherence, etc. would you have to reverse, and what would you have to reverse in the compound of six, etc.?

original: la sogs pa'i 'brel pa med par mi 'gyur na 'o na ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i 'brel pa med par mi 'gyur na 'o na ni zhes smos te /
translated: Well, then, the relation of inherence, etc. would not exist for the entities of the qualifier and the qualified.

original: bshad pa 'di ni gsal lo //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di ni gsal lo //
translated: But this explanation is clear.

original: 'di ni gnyis kyi bar gnas pa nyid kyi khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis kyi bar gnas pa nyid kyi khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is said by accepting the middle term between the two.

original: da ni de nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni de nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, the statement “it does not exist as reality” is

original: yod pa nyid dang 'brel zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang 'brel zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “the relation of existence.”

original: 'chad pa ni mtha' gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'chad pa ni mtha' gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation is “by the two extremes.”

original: de ni skye 'jig can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni skye 'jig can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is not subject to origination and destruction.

original: 'on te rtag pa phyir na yod pa dang de'i 'brel pa mtha' dag gi khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa phyir na yod pa dang de'i 'brel pa mtha' dag gi khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi /
translated: But if it is permanent, then it is not the case that the relation of existence and all its distinctions are reversed.

original: 'on kyang don gang la de gnyis yod //
analyzed: 'on kyang don gang la de gnyis yod //
translated: But what is the meaning of the two terms?

original: de nyid mtha' dag gi khyad par du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid mtha' dag gi khyad par du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The meaning is that the word “impermanent” is a qualifier of the thing.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that is the meaning, then the response is “No!”

original: de'i khyad par can ni mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par can no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par can ni mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par can no //
translated: The thing that is qualified is qualified by the two extremes.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: sgra'i 'jug pa'i rgyu ni dngos po yin na mi rtag pa'i rgyu ni yod pa'am de dang 'brel pa dag ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra'i 'jug pa'i rgyu ni dngos po yin na mi rtag pa'i rgyu ni yod pa'am de dang 'brel pa dag ma yin gyi /
translated: The cause of the application of the word is a thing. The cause of impermanence is not existence or its relation,

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: but rather impermanence itself.

original: des na mi rtag pa'i sgra las dngos po rtog par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa'i sgra las dngos po rtog par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: So how can the word “impermanent” be understood to refer to a thing?

original: gal te yod pa mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'dod la mi rtag pa'i sgra'i dngos po'i rkyen kyang tha dad pa'i mi rtag pa nyid rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yod pa mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'dod la mi rtag pa'i sgra'i dngos po'i rkyen kyang tha dad pa'i mi rtag pa nyid rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If you do not accept that existence is impermanent, and the word “impermanent” does not express a different impermanence that is the property of a thing,🔽then what is the meaning of the word “impermanent”?

original: de'i tshe tha dad pa med pa'i phyir na sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i drug par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni yod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe tha dad pa med pa'i phyir na sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i drug par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni yod pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: At that time, since there is no difference, the sixth case, the genitive, would not be used in the expression “impermanence of sound.”🔽In response to this, the root text states, “Because of existence.”

original: ji ltar tha dad pa med kyang yod pa nyid gnas so zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po'i mi rtag pa zhes drug par ci ste mi 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa med kyang yod pa nyid gnas so zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du dngos po'i mi rtag pa zhes drug par ci ste mi 'dod //
translated: Just as there is no difference, but existence is still possible, why not accept that the sixth case is used in the expression “impermanence of a thing” in the same way?

original: de lta na mi rtag pa nyid tha dad par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na mi rtag pa nyid tha dad par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is not tenable that impermanence is different.

original: yang na sgra'i tshul lam rigs pas mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par can gyi yod pa mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: yang na sgra'i tshul lam rigs pas mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par can gyi yod pa mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Or, because of the absence of a position that sound’s impermanence is existence that is qualified by the two extremes,

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid tha dad pa'i mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir la ni drug pa la sogs pa med pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs su mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid tha dad pa'i mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir la ni drug pa la sogs pa med pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs su mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa ni /
translated: the absence of the sixth case, etc., does not provide an opportunity for the error that impermanence is the nonexistence of what existed before and the nonexistence after destruction.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Moreover” means:

original: de las zhes bya ba ni dngos po las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni dngos po las so //
translated: “From that” means: from the entity.

original: de ltar snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i bar nas yod pa'i yod pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'thad la der khas len na yang de gnyis nyid mi rtag par thal lo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i bar nas yod pa'i yod pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'thad la der khas len na yang de gnyis nyid mi rtag par thal lo zhes bstan pa yin no //
