translated: Thus, it is untenable that the existence of the existent in the interval between prior non-existence and subsequent non-existence is impermanent. But if you accept that, then it follows that both of those are impermanent. This is the point.

original: da ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gang gi 'brel pa khas mi len pa'i phyir med pa gnyis kyi dbus na gnas pa'i yod pa mi rtag pa nyid ma yin la /🔽de khas blangs pa sngon du song ba can gyi @149a * //
analyzed: da ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gang gi 'brel pa khas mi len pa'i phyir med pa gnyis kyi dbus na gnas pa'i yod pa mi rtag pa nyid ma yin la / de khas blangs pa sngon du song ba can gyi @149a * //
translated: Now, since you do not accept the relation of existence and non-existence, the existent that abides in the interval between the two non-existents is not impermanent.

original: snga na med pa la sogs pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: But if you accept that, then the prior non-existence and so on are not impermanent.

original: 'on kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i yang gnyis kyi dbus na gnas pa'i yod pa mi rtag pa nyid yin na zhes bsams nas gzhan dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i yang gnyis kyi dbus na gnas pa'i yod pa mi rtag pa nyid yin na zhes bsams nas gzhan dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: However, if the existent that abides in the interval between the two, which are the cause and effect, is impermanent, then, thinking that, the opponent raises another objection.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If you say” is the thought.

original: bum pa'i rgyu ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: bum pa'i rgyu ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The cause of the pot is the potter, etc.

original: 'bras bu ni gyo mo la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni gyo mo la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The effect is the shards, etc.

original: de ltar yin du zad mod /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zad mod /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: des cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: what is the point?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gis //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gis //
translated: By those causes and effects,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says.

original: ji ltar mi rigs pa med pa snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs pa med pa snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is no inconsistency,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says “cause and effect,”

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mtshan nyid can dag dang ngo //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mtshan nyid can dag dang ngo //
translated: which have the characteristic of the prior limit and the subsequent limit.

original: dngos po'i zhes bya ba ni dbus na gnas pa'i'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes bya ba ni dbus na gnas pa'i'o //
translated: “ Entity” refers to that which exists in the middle.

original: gal te de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi dbus na gnas pa'i yod pa ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi dbus na gnas pa'i yod pa ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, how could the existence that exists in the middle between the two limits that are the cause and effect be impermanent?

original: yod pa nyid dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says “existence itself.”

original: rtsod pa rjes su brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lan rnam 'grel gyi phyed kyis ston pa na gal te zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: rtsod pa rjes su brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lan rnam 'grel gyi phyed kyis ston pa na gal te zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The answer, preceded by the statement of the dispute, is taught by half of a verse of the Vigrahavyāvartanī: “If you think that existence itself is impermanent, then you are refuting our position.”

original: gal te ji skad brjod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis mtha' yin no //
analyzed: gal te ji skad brjod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis mtha' yin no //
translated: If the two extremes of cause and effect are as you have stated,

original: de'i tshe khyad par med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyad par med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then there would be no difference between them.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The extremes of cause and effect

original: de dag ni yod pa'i khyad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ni yod pa'i khyad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: would not differ in terms of existence.

original: ci'i phyir de dag khyad par du mi 'gyur zhe na 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag khyad par du mi 'gyur zhe na 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why would they not differ? Because there would be no connection.

original: rtag pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i mtha' dag dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i mtha' dag dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The permanent is not connected to the extremes of cause and effect,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyams par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that its intrinsic reality would be impaired.

original: 'on te dngos po gang la yod pa dang 'brel pa dag gnas pa de'i khyad par rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i mtha' dag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po gang la yod pa dang 'brel pa dag gnas pa de'i khyad par rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i mtha' dag yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the extremes of cause and effect are the differences of that which is connected to existence,

original: 'di yang log pa yin te mtha' de dag ni de'i yang khyad par ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang log pa yin te mtha' de dag ni de'i yang khyad par ma yin te /
translated: then this is also wrong, because those extremes are not its differences.

original: sngon med pa dang 'brel pa khas mi len pa'i phyir rigs pa can pa yis ni dngos po la snga na med pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon med pa dang 'brel pa khas mi len pa'i phyir rigs pa can pa yis ni dngos po la snga na med pa 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: The Naiyāyikas do not accept that a thing is nonexistent prior to its existence, because they do not accept that a thing is related to what is nonexistent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i lugs kyi ni dngos po snga na med pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i lugs kyi ni dngos po snga na med pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, in their system, there is no expression “prior nonexistence” at all.

original: gal te de lta yin mod de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po'i yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin mod de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po'i yin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, how could cause and effect not be things?

original: snga na med pa de'i khyad par can gyi brjod pa gang la yod pa de ni de'i khyad par can no //
analyzed: snga na med pa de'i khyad par can gyi brjod pa gang la yod pa de ni de'i khyad par can no //
translated: That which has the expression “prior nonexistence” is qualified by that.

original: brjod pa de gang dag la yod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: brjod pa de gang dag la yod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de yang mi 'grub po //
translated: The cause and effect that have that expression are not established.

original: de'i khyad par can gyi brjod pa snga na med pa la brten nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad thob pa ni //
analyzed: de'i khyad par can gyi brjod pa snga na med pa la brten nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad thob pa ni //
translated: The expression “prior nonexistence” is based on the acquisition of the convention of cause and effect.

original: dngos po'am rig pa can de @149b la mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dngos po'am rig pa can de @149b la mi 'grub bo //
translated: That is not established for the Naiyāyikas.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Why?

original: 'on te 'brel pa yod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa yod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that they are related,

original: dngos po ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then he says, “Things are not related to non-things.”

original: ci'i phyir khas mi len snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khas mi len snyam na /
translated: Why do you not accept this?

original: khas len zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khas len zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Because it is not accepted.”

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Nonexistence prior to existence and post-existence are impermanent.”

original: des na yod pa'i yod pa nyid mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar rang gi gzhung nyams pa dang / snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa mtha' yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs las rgyu dang 'bras bu mtha' yin no zhes bya ba'i mtha' phyogs gzhan de la brten pa yang nyams par 'gyur ro zhes rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: des na yod pa'i yod pa nyid mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar rang gi gzhung nyams pa dang / snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa mtha' yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs las rgyu dang 'bras bu mtha' yin no zhes bya ba'i mtha' phyogs gzhan de la brten pa yang nyams par 'gyur ro zhes rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, he says, “The existence of an existent is impermanent,” thereby undermining your own position. And he says, “Nonexistence prior to existence and post-existence are the extremes,” and he says, “Cause and effect are the extremes,” thereby undermining the position that the other extreme is based on that.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag 'brel par khas mi len na nyes pa 'di yod pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag 'brel par khas mi len na nyes pa 'di yod pa des na'o //
translated: He says, “Because this error exists if you do not accept that things and non-things are related.”

original: 'on kyang 'brel pa med mod /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'brel pa med mod /
translated: But if you think that they are not related,🔽then he says, “If they are not related, how can they be the extremes?”

original: de lta na yang dngos po'i rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam na brjod pa'i khyad par 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po'i rgyu dang 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam na brjod pa'i khyad par 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that it is the cause and effect of a thing, then it is said, “this distinction.”

original: de med na zhes bya ba na snga na med pa'i khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba na snga na med pa'i khyad par med pa'o //
translated: If it does not exist, then it is a distinction without a prior.

original: der zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i khyad par du'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i khyad par du'o //
translated: There, in the distinction that is expressed.

original: gang med par 'gyur ba brjod pa'i khyad par de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang med par 'gyur ba brjod pa'i khyad par de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that distinction that is expressed as not existing?

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is said.

original: 'o na rgyur 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyur 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is a cause,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “without an effect.”

original: de ltar snga na med pa'i khyad par la ltos pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni de med na mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin na ni de'i khyad par la ma ltos pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar snga na med pa'i khyad par la ltos pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni de med na mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin na ni de'i khyad par la ma ltos pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, if cause and effect depend on a distinction without a prior, and it is said that they do not occur without it, then because it does not depend on that distinction, it is said, “also.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyi rang bzhin de ni gang rnam par gzhan ni gang zhig des de med par ni ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyi rang bzhin de ni gang rnam par gzhan ni gang zhig des de med par ni ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of cause and effect? What is the difference? How could it be without that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “in this way.”

original: gang gis de med par 'gyur ba snga na med pa nyid du khyad par can ni rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu yod pa nyid dang 'brel pa de 'du ba'am /
analyzed: gang gis de med par 'gyur ba snga na med pa nyid du khyad par can ni rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu yod pa nyid dang 'brel pa de 'du ba'am /
translated: But it is not the cause of the effect, because it is not different from the effect, since it is not nonexistent prior to the effect.

original: 'bras bu rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa'i 'du ba de byed pa'i phyir na rgyu yin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa'i 'du ba de byed pa'i phyir na rgyu yin no zhes grag go //
translated: Rather, it is the cause of the effect because it is related to the existence of the effect, or because it is the conjunction of the effect with its cause.

original: sgra ni 'dod pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ni 'dod pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: Sound is not accepted in this way.

original: de ltar phyed snga mas de'i rang bzhin brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyed snga mas de'i rang bzhin brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the first half of the verse states its nature.

original: re zhig dngos po'i rang bzhin ni byed pa ma yin la yod pa dang 'brel pa yang rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig dngos po'i rang bzhin ni byed pa ma yin la yod pa dang 'brel pa yang rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan brjod pa'o //
translated: The second half of the verse states another aspect of its nature: The nature of an entity is not a creator, and that which is related to existence is permanent.

original: 'o na 'dir 'bras bu gang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang 'brel pa dang rgyu dang 'brel pa la skye bar khas len na yod pa ni re zhig byed pa ma yin te rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na 'dir 'bras bu gang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang 'brel pa dang rgyu dang 'brel pa la skye bar khas len na yod pa ni re zhig byed pa ma yin te rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one accepts that the effect arises in relation to that which is desired and in relation to the cause, then that which exists is not a creator, because it is permanent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa yang mi byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa yang mi byed do //
translated: For that very reason, it does not create a relation.

original: des ci yang mi byed pa des na gang zhig skyed par byed pas rgyu yin /
analyzed: des ci yang mi byed pa des na gang zhig skyed par byed pas rgyu yin /
translated: Since it does not do anything, what is it that causes generation?

original: des na phyi mas ni @150a * //
analyzed: des na phyi mas ni @150a * //
translated: Therefore, the latter

original: de med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: means that it does not exist.🔽Is the effect in the process of arising joined with its cause?

original: skye bzhin pa'i 'bras bu nyid rang gi rgyu dang 'du ba yin nam /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i 'bras bu nyid rang gi rgyu dang 'du ba yin nam /
translated: Or is the effect already arisen joined with its cause?

original: skyes zin pa'i 'bras bu 'du shes de ltar lugs gnyis bsdu pa'i phyir na phal cher gyi sgra smras so //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i 'bras bu 'du shes de ltar lugs gnyis bsdu pa'i phyir na phal cher gyi sgra smras so //
translated: Since the two systems are included in this way, the word “mostly” is used.

original: de ltar phyed snga ma bshad nas phyi ma 'chad pa ni yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyed snga ma bshad nas phyi ma 'chad pa ni yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having explained the first half in this way, the second half is explained:🔽“If it exists, it is not generated; if it is generated, it does not exist.”

original: 'o na dngos po 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that a thing becomes an effect,

original: dngos po yang pa ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang 'brel pa byas pa med par ro //
analyzed: dngos po yang pa ni zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang 'brel pa byas pa med par ro //
translated: “A thing that exists” means that it is related to existence and is not produced.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: “That” refers to a thing.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nas snga na med pa'i khyad par med par ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nas snga na med pa'i khyad par med par ro //
translated: “By its own nature alone” means that it is not distinguished by prior nonexistence.

original: gang zhig med pa de byed na zhes bya ba ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang zhig med pa de byed na zhes bya ba ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “If it does not exist, it is produced” means that it is like that. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: khyod kyi 'dod pa dang sbyar na ni de ltar yang ma gyur te zhes brjod pa ni dngos po sngar med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'dod pa dang sbyar na ni de ltar yang ma gyur te zhes brjod pa ni dngos po sngar med ces bya ba'o //
translated: If you assert that, then it is not so, as stated. This is the nonexistence of a thing that previously existed.

original: ldog bzhin pa'i dngos po nyid dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir snga na med pa dang ma 'brel yang dngos po 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gzhan gyi 'dod pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: ldog bzhin pa'i dngos po nyid dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir snga na med pa dang ma 'brel yang dngos po 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gzhan gyi 'dod pa brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o//
translated: Since the very thing that is ceasing is a nonthing, even without a prior nonexistence, a thing would become a result. The assertion of another is stated in “If you say. . . .”

original: des na zhes bya ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Then” means because of nonexistence.

original: 'di sel bar byed pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di sel bar byed pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of that is “What?”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te med pa dang lhan cig 'brel ba med par yang med pa yin na de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te med pa dang lhan cig 'brel ba med par yang med pa yin na de'i tshe'o //
translated: “If it were not so” means if nonexistence were not related to something that exists, then.

original: gal te de lta na yin mod /🔽de las cir 'gyur zhen de na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yin mod / de las cir 'gyur zhen de na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If that is so, then what?”

original: de lta na yin mod ce na khas kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na yin mod ce na khas kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: “If that is so, then what?” “If that is so, then I agree.”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa dang lhan cig mi 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa dang lhan cig mi 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of the non-existence of the entity prior to it and because of the non-concomitance with it,

original: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po snga na med pa la sogs pa dang ma 'brel na nye bar 'gyur ba kho na gang gi dngos po'i dngos po med pa de mi rag pa nyid du 'gyur ba snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po snga na med pa la sogs pa dang ma 'brel na nye bar 'gyur ba kho na gang gi dngos po'i dngos po med pa de mi rag pa nyid du 'gyur ba snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: when there is no concomitance with the entity prior to it, etc., then the non-existence of that entity which is the basis of the non-existence would be just non-existent, i.e., the non-existence which has the characteristic of prior non-existence and post-cessation non-existence,

original: can dngos po'i dus na yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa dang / dngos po ji ltar 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: can dngos po'i dus na yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa dang / dngos po ji ltar 'brel zhe na /
translated: and which does not exist at the time of the entity. How can there be a relation between the entity and the non-existence?

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore,

original: don med sgro 'dogs pa ni don la reg pa dang bral ba'i ste bla'o //
analyzed: don med sgro 'dogs pa ni don la reg pa dang bral ba'i ste bla'o //
translated: the superimposition of the non-existent is the cognition which is devoid of contact with the object.

original: gang dag la don du mngon par 'dod pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i sgra de dag la yang brjod bya tha dad par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: gang dag la don du mngon par 'dod pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i sgra de dag la yang brjod bya tha dad par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Even with regard to those words which do not have a different object of reference that is desired, one applies a different object of reference.

original: de'i phyir blo de nyid ldog pa ste tha dad zhig pa dang tha dad pa mi rtag pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis rten de rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo de nyid ldog pa ste tha dad zhig pa dang tha dad pa mi rtag pa zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis rten de rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Therefore, the very cognition that is the basis is the reason for the name “disappearance” or “impermanence,” which is a different name for that very cognition.

original: don tha dad dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don tha dad dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Different objects” refers to

original: gang gi sgras bsdus pa don tha dad par mngon par 'dod pa dag la 'brel pa rtogs pas bkod par brjod pa ni dngos po las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi sgras bsdus pa don tha dad par mngon par 'dod pa dag la 'brel pa rtogs pas bkod par brjod pa ni dngos po las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: those that are held to be different objects, which are included by the word “etc.” The statement “because of the understanding of the relation” is the reason.

original: 'brel pa ni @150b gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir tha dad pa kho nar 'brel pa yin no zhes bsams nas gzhan dag dogs par byed pa na tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni @150b gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir tha dad pa kho nar 'brel pa yin no zhes bsams nas gzhan dag dogs par byed pa na tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking that the relation is only different because it exists in two things, others doubt this, saying, “It is different.”

original: tha dad pa ni 'brel pa ma yin no zhes dogs nas grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gsungs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni 'brel pa ma yin no zhes dogs nas grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gsungs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Fearing that difference is not a relation, the proponent of the thesis says, “If it is different, it is not a relation.”

original: gal te tha dad pa nyid 'brel pa yin no zhes bshad zin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa nyid 'brel pa yin no zhes bshad zin pa ma yin nam /
translated: “ But isn’t it explained that difference is a relation?”

original: des na 'di skad ci ste brjod snyam na /
analyzed: des na 'di skad ci ste brjod snyam na /
translated: “ In that case, why is this said?”

original: tha dad par ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha dad par ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Different” is stated.

original: thams cad la 'brel pa yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad la 'brel pa yod par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there would be a connection with everything.

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'brel pa gzhan dag kyang dogs pa byas nas sbong ba tha dad yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'brel pa gzhan dag kyang dogs pa byas nas sbong ba tha dad yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In the case of identity” and so on. Having raised the doubt of another connection, he refutes it: “If there were difference . . .”

original: phyed snga ma yan rkang pa gnyis pa 'brel pa ni tha dad pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed snga ma yan rkang pa gnyis pa 'brel pa ni tha dad pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first half of the verse, up to the second line, is the statement of the doubt: “In the case of difference . . .”

original: gal te zhes bya ba la ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: “If . . .” is the statement of the doubt.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: “No” is the refutation of the doubt.

original: de las ni zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa la'o //
analyzed: de las ni zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa la'o //
translated: “In that case” is in the case of nondifference.

original: ji ltar brtag pa'i yul can du 'gyur ba zhe na de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brtag pa'i yul can du 'gyur ba zhe na de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “How could it be a conceptual cognition?”

original: rkang pa dang po 'chad pa ni tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dang po 'chad pa ni tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The first line is explained: “Difference . . .”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i dogs pa bsu ba nas 'gog pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa'i dogs pa bsu ba nas 'gog pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the doubt that it is a connection of cause and effect is from “If . . .”

original: ji ltar rtag pa'i yul can du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa'i yul can du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “How could it be a permanent cognition?”

original: mngon sum gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase by direct perception is stated.

original: phyed phyi ma ni bla ba'i phyir ma bkrol to //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma ni bla ba'i phyir ma bkrol to //
translated: The latter half is not explained because it is obvious.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad na mi gnas pa de'i phyir 'di ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad na mi gnas pa de'i phyir 'di ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: The phrase because it does not endure is the connection.

original: gang gi phyir don dam pa min pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam pa min pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because it is not ultimate is the reason.

original: skabs kyi mjug sdud pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi mjug sdud pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase therefore concludes the section.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa yang mi rtag pa nyid dang / bdag nyid ma yin pa dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa yang mi rtag pa nyid dang / bdag nyid ma yin pa dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of an entity prior to its arising and its nonexistence after its cessation are established by impermanence and by the nonobservation of the entity itself.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag go snyam pa'i shes pa kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa spyi sbyor bas skye ba ni tshad ma gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag go snyam pa'i shes pa kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa spyi sbyor bas skye ba ni tshad ma gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The cognition that thinks color and so on are impermanent is not a separate valid cognition because it arises from the application of impermanence and so on to the universals of color and so on.

original: gzhal bya gzhan gyi yul can ma yin pa de bas na'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan gyi yul can ma yin pa de bas na'o //
translated: The phrase because it is not a separate object of knowledge is the reason.

original: tshad ma gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis kha dog la sogs pa skad cig ma nyid la sogs par shes ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis kha dog la sogs pa skad cig ma nyid la sogs par shes ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “There is no other valid cognition” means that there is no other cognition of the momentariness of color, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhal bya zhes smos te /
analyzed: gzhal bya zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, “because of the object of comprehension.”

original: spyi dang khyad par can gyi gzhal bya gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par can gyi gzhal bya gzhan med pas so //
translated: Because there is no other object of comprehension, either general or specific.

original: ci'i phyir med snyam na kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med snyam na kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why is there none? Because the generality of impermanence is applied to the generality of color.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir kha dog la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa'o snyam pa'i shes @151a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kha dog la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa'o snyam pa'i shes @151a * //
translated: Because the cognition “color, etc. is impermanent”

original: pas ni kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa'i spyi sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: pas ni kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa'i spyi sbyar ba yin te /
translated: applies the generality of impermanence to the generality of color,

original: des na de ni gzhal bya gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de ni gzhal bya gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: therefore that is not another object of comprehension.

original: gal te tshad ma'i rjes las byung ba de nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma'i rjes las byung ba de nyid 'di yin no //
translated: If that is the case, then that is the valid cognition that arises subsequent to valid cognition.

original: mnyam du mtshams sbyor bar byed spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid can gyi gzhal bya'i yul can ni tshad ma gzhan yin no zhes dogs na yang dang yang ngo shes kyang tshad ma gzhan min zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mnyam du mtshams sbyor bar byed spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid can gyi gzhal bya'i yul can ni tshad ma gzhan yin no zhes dogs na yang dang yang ngo shes kyang tshad ma gzhan min zhes 'brel to //
translated: If you suspect that the subject of the object of knowledge, which has the nature of a general and particular, is another valid cognition, then the connection is: although there is repeated recognition, it is not another valid cognition.

original: dran pa dang 'dod pa can no //
analyzed: dran pa dang 'dod pa can no //
translated: It is memory and desire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi 'dod par thal phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi 'dod par thal phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it would follow that they are not accepted.

original: mi 'dod par zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnams kyi tshad nges pa med pa'i phyir na mi 'dod par thal ba'i phyir ro //🔽don 'di yin te tshad mas mthong ba la yang dang yang ngo shes par byed pa ni tshad ma snga ma dang khyad par med pa'i yul can de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa des na tshad ma gzhan ma yin te dper na dran pa la
analyzed: mi 'dod par zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnams kyi tshad nges pa med pa'i phyir na mi 'dod par thal ba'i phyir ro // don 'di yin te tshad mas mthong ba la yang dang yang ngo shes par byed pa ni tshad ma snga ma dang khyad par med pa'i yul can de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa des na tshad ma gzhan ma yin te dper na dran pa la
translated: Not accepted means that it would follow that they are not accepted because there is no fixed number of valid cognitions.

original: sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: This is the meaning: The repeated recognition of what is seen by valid cognition is a subject that is not different from the previous valid cognition. Since it is established and happy with that, it is not another valid cognition, just as, for example, the consciousnesses of memory🔽and so on are.

original: de lta na yang tshad ma yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshad ma yin na ni /
translated: Even so, if it is a valid cognition,

original: tshad ma rnams kyis drangs pa des pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyis drangs pa des pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yin no //
translated: “The validity of the cognition would be destroyed” means that the validity of the cognition would be lost.🔽This has already been explained in the statement, “We do not accept that the cognition is valid because it apprehends the object,” and so on.

original: 'di yang gzhan ni gzung ba'i 'dzin pa'i phyir na tshad ma nyid mi 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa yin la rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir yang smras pas na nyes pa med do //🔽yang ngo shes par zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gzhan ni gzung ba'i 'dzin pa'i phyir na tshad ma nyid mi 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa yin la rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir yang smras pas na nyes pa med do // yang ngo shes par zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The word “also” in the line “and the memory itself” is explained as follows.

original: dran pa nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word “itself” in the line “and the memory itself” means that it is not a valid cognition.

original: dbang po'i byed pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshod par ni dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes dpag dang mi slu ba tshad ma de'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshod par ni dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes dpag dang mi slu ba tshad ma de'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “from the functioning of the sense faculty” and so on is stated to indicate that the functioning of the sense faculty is the reason for the nondeceptive valid cognition.

original: de la dbang po'i byed pa la brten pa nyid de zhig dgag pa'i phyir brjod pa ni yang ngo //
analyzed: de la dbang po'i byed pa la brten pa nyid de zhig dgag pa'i phyir brjod pa ni yang ngo //
translated: The word “also” is stated to refute the idea that the functioning of the sense faculty is the basis of the valid cognition.

original: shes par byed pa ni dbang po'i byed pa brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed pa ni dbang po'i byed pa brten pa ma yin no //
translated: The functioning of the sense faculty is not the basis of the cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po'i byed pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The function of the sense faculty is...

original: gzhan nye ba tsam gyi yul can du myong bas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan nye ba tsam gyi yul can du myong bas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The experience of the object that is merely near is described in the phrase “if it were...

original: ji ltar 'jug ste mi 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug ste mi 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: How does it engage? It does not engage.

original: 'jug pa yang yin te de'i phyir nye ba'i yul can ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang yin te de'i phyir nye ba'i yul can ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does engage, and therefore it is not the experience of a near object. This is the meaning.🔽The conclusion is stated in the phrase “that is not so...

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni de nyid ces bya bas ni rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug ba nyid min te rnam pa gzhan du 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni de ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni de nyid ces bya bas ni rtog pa dang ldan pa 'jug ba nyid min te rnam pa gzhan du 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni de ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The argument is stated in the phrase “because it is seen to engage in a different way.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: If that is so, then how does it engage?

original: de ni phan 'bras zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni phan 'bras zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is given in the phrase “it engages in the effect.

original: gal te de nyid ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de nyid ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “that is not so” is explained in the phrase “because it is seen to engage in a different way.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The answer is given in the phrase “because it is seen to engage in a different way.

original: gal te yang 'jug pa'i yul don bya ba sgrub @151b bar byed pa yin pa de lta na yang don bya ba sgrub par byed pa de ni de nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'jug pa'i yul don bya ba sgrub @151b bar byed pa yin pa de lta na yang don bya ba sgrub par byed pa de ni de nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If, although the object of engagement is the establishment of the object to be engaged, still, the establishment of the object to be engaged is just that,

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then by that very thing,

original: sngar mthong ba de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba de nyid kyis so //
translated: by that very seeing previously.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rang gi zhes gsungs so //🔽'on te mngon sum yang don bya ba sgrub pa'i yul can nyid yin na des byas pa'i 'jug pa ni de sgrub pa'i yul can du gyur pa des na tshad ma ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dran pa nyid gang zhig yin /
analyzed: rang gi zhes gsungs so // 'on te mngon sum yang don bya ba sgrub pa'i yul can nyid yin na des byas pa'i 'jug pa ni de sgrub pa'i yul can du gyur pa des na tshad ma ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dran pa nyid gang zhig yin /
translated: Because of its own object.🔽But if direct perception is the subject that establishes the object to be engaged, then the engagement that it produces is the subject that establishes that. Therefore, what is the reason that memory is not a valid cognition?🔽If memory is a valid cognition, then there would be an infinite number of valid cognitions.

original: dran pa yin yang tshad ma yin na ni tshad ma rnams mtha' med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dogs pa zhe la bzhag pas lan 'debs pa ni don byed pa'i 'brel pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa yin yang tshad ma yin na ni tshad ma rnams mtha' med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dogs pa zhe la bzhag pas lan 'debs pa ni don byed pa'i 'brel pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to the qualm that is being harbored is “The connection to the functioning thing.”

original: gal te don byed pa'i 'brel pa mngon sum gyi yul yin na ni nyes pa 'dir 'gyur nyid ni 'on kyang 'di ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te don byed pa'i 'brel pa mngon sum gyi yul yin na ni nyes pa 'dir 'gyur nyid ni 'on kyang 'di ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin te /
translated: If the relation of causal capacity were the object of perception, then this error would occur. But it is not the object of perception.

original: gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not manifest.

original: 'o na de su'i yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de su'i yul yin zhe na /
translated: Well, then, whose object is it?

original: sngon mthong nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon mthong nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is the object of memory.

original: me la sogs pa'i don byed pa dang 'brel pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis sngar mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i don byed pa dang 'brel pa ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis sngar mthong ba yin te /
translated: The relation of causal capacity with fire, etc. is seen previously by perception and non-apprehension.

original: de nyid do shes pas dran pa'i phyir ngo shes nyid kyi yul yin no //
analyzed: de nyid do shes pas dran pa'i phyir ngo shes nyid kyi yul yin no //
translated: Because it is remembered by the cognition of that, it is the object of recognition.

original: des na dran pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni 'di kho na'i yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na dran pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni 'di kho na'i yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the intention that only this is the error of memory, etc.

original: ci sta 'di yin dran pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci sta 'di yin dran pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is asked, “Is this not memory?

original: dngos po pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: dngos po pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Because it grasps the intrinsic reality of the thing,” anticipating this doubt,

original: de'i don zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i don zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “its object.”

original: sngon mthong ba'i don bya ba byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sngon mthong ba'i don bya ba byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the causal capacity of the object previously seen.

original: de lta na yang ji ltar dran pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar dran pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it be memory?

original: sngon mthong ba nyid du zhes gsungs so //🔽tshad mas mthong ba la yang de shes par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba nyid du zhes gsungs so // tshad mas mthong ba la yang de shes par byed pa ni /
translated: It is said that it is just the seeing of what was seen before.

original: sngar gyi tshad dang yul khyad par med pa des na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa ma yin pas na /🔽dran pa gzung ba la 'dzin par byed pa yin pas na /
analyzed: sngar gyi tshad dang yul khyad par med pa des na grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa ma yin pas na / dran pa gzung ba la 'dzin par byed pa yin pas na /
translated: And with regard to seeing by means of a valid cognition, the object of that is not different from the previous valid cognition, and therefore it is not a different establishment or a different happiness.

original: dran pa gzung ba la 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa gzung ba la 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, memory is the apprehension of what was apprehended, and it is not another valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: 'on te spyi dang khyad par bdag nyid gzhal bya'i yul can yin pa'i phyir na tshad ma gzhan yin no zhe na 'di la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te spyi dang khyad par bdag nyid gzhal bya'i yul can yin pa'i phyir na tshad ma gzhan yin no zhe na 'di la zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if it is another valid cognition because it has as its object a universal and a particular, then the reply is this.

original: sbyor ba'i rnam par brjod pa ni de'i don byed par dung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽'di la yang zhes bya ba ni dpe la mthong ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rnam par brjod pa ni de'i don byed par dung ba'i zhes bya ba'o // 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni dpe la mthong ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The statement of the syllogism is: “That which is desirous of the object’s functioning. . . .”🔽And here also, the example is not just mere seeing,

original: de ltar mngon sum gyis mthong ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum gyis mthong ba la yang ngo //
translated: but it is also the seeing by means of direct perception.

original: spyi tsam gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir na nyes pa 'dir thal ba med do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: spyi tsam gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir na nyes pa 'dir thal ba med do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Since it is the subject of a general object, this fault does not ensue.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa yang ji ltar tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa yang ji ltar tshad ma yin te /
translated: If inference is a valid cognition, how is it?

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis bstan pa'i don mi skye ba'i phyir @152a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis bstan pa'i don mi skye ba'i phyir @152a * //
translated: Because the object taught is not produced by momentariness,

original: ro zhes dogs pa bsu pa de dag ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ro zhes dogs pa bsu pa de dag ces gsungs so //
translated: the objection is anticipated and the response is: “Those . . .”

original: bstan pa dang thob pa de dag tha mi dad pa nyid du sgro btags nas /
analyzed: bstan pa dang thob pa de dag tha mi dad pa nyid du sgro btags nas /
translated: Having superimposed the non-difference of the taught and the obtained,

original: gcig nyid kyi tha snyad byed de des na 'di yang nye bar thob par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi tha snyad byed de des na 'di yang nye bar thob par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the convention of oneness is made. Therefore, since it causes the obtainment of that, it is a valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: gal te dngos la tshul gcig ba can ma yin /
analyzed: gal te dngos la tshul gcig ba can ma yin /
translated: If it does not have the same mode of being as the object,

original: 'o na mi slu ba yul gcig pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi slu ba yul gcig pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would be non-deceptive with respect to a single object.

original: mi slu ba yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi slu ba yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Non-deceptive” is stated.

original: tshad ma 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad pa'o //
translated: It is not only a valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: du ma nyid yin yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: du ma nyid yin yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Even though it is manifold” is stated.

original: nye bar btags pa'i gcig pa nyid du ni ma zad de /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i gcig pa nyid du ni ma zad de /
translated: Not only is there no real unity,

original: bgrod par bya ba ma yin par ma la sogs par 'grong bar lung las nye bar bstan pa ni skad cig gi rgyur ma ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ma yin par ma la sogs par 'grong bar lung las nye bar bstan pa ni skad cig gi rgyur ma ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: but also the statement in the scriptures that one goes to a place that is not to be gone to, such as the past, is not based on a momentary cause.

original: skad cig gcig gi yul can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gi yul can ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the object of a single moment is gone to.

original: nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung ba'i rgyu ni gcig gi tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin par bgrod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung ba'i rgyu ni gcig gi tha snyad kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin par bgrod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of appropriation and the result of appropriation are the objects of the convention of one.

original: de ltar na mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i mtshams sbyor ba ni gzung ba 'dzin pas tha snyad tsam gyi yul can yin pas yid ni spyi tsam gyi yul can yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i mtshams sbyor ba ni gzung ba 'dzin pas tha snyad tsam gyi yul can yin pas yid ni spyi tsam gyi yul can yin te /
translated: Thus, the mind that is connected to the subsequent state of direct perception is the subject that is the object of mere convention, which is the apprehension of the object. Therefore, the mind is the subject that is the object of mere generality.

original: des na gzhal bya gzhan srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhal bya gzhan srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no other object of comprehension.

original: des na gzhal bya ba rnam pa gnyis kho na zhes grangs nges pa grub po zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhal bya ba rnam pa gnyis kho na zhes grangs nges pa grub po zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the number of objects of comprehension is definitely two.

original: de ni gang las yul rnam pa gnyis nges par 'grub pa ste las mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi yul nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges par grub pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gang las yul rnam pa gnyis nges par 'grub pa ste las mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi yul nges pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nges par grub pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is from that that the ascertainment of the two kinds of objects is accomplished, i.e., the ascertainment of the object of perception and inference, which is characterized as the establishment of the object.

original: spyi'i yul can zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa'i yul can no //
translated: The phrase “having a general object” means having an evident object.

original: khyad par gyi yul can zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi yul can zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can no //
translated: The phrase “having a particular object” means having a hidden object.

original: 'di tsam gyi ni 'on gang zhig kha dog la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa'i lan brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyi ni 'on gang zhig kha dog la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa'i lan brjod pa yin no //
translated: This much is the response to the objection, “What is color, etc.?”

original: da ni gcig la yang du ma nyid ni 'jug phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa spang bar 'dod pas de nyid zlos par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni gcig la yang du ma nyid ni 'jug phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa spang bar 'dod pas de nyid zlos par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to reject the objection that “a single entity has many natures because of the engagement of many names,” he repeats the objection, saying, “If you say that a single entity has many natures because of the engagement of many names,” etc.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i khyad par rjes su dpag pa de ni khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i khyad par kho na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i khyad par rjes su dpag pa de ni khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i khyad par kho na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: The difference that is seen by perception is the difference that is inferred from what is seen, and it is only that which is seen by perception.

original: khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pas khyad par kho na 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pas khyad par kho na 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The difference that is inferred from what is seen grasps only the difference.

original: sngar ni de mngon sum gyis bzung nas phyir yang de nyid la des sngar mthong ba ni de nyid yin no zhes 'du ba'i sgo nas @152b rtogs so //
analyzed: sngar ni de mngon sum gyis bzung nas phyir yang de nyid la des sngar mthong ba ni de nyid yin no zhes 'du ba'i sgo nas @152b rtogs so //
translated: Having previously apprehended that by perception, it again realizes that by means of association, thinking, “That is the same as that which was previously seen.”

original: des na tshad ma yul gcig la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma yul gcig la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, a valid cognition engages a single object.

original: 'dis ni 'di ltar tshad ma 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di ltar tshad ma 'dod pa yin te /
translated: This is how valid cognition is asserted.

original: gang tshad ma yin pa de ni yul nges pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang tshad ma yin pa de ni yul nges pa can ma yin no //
translated: That which is a valid cognition does not have a determined object.

original: dper na khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the knowledge that is an inference from what is seen.

original: mngon sum yang tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum yang tshad ma yin no //
translated: Perception is also a valid cognition.

original: des na de yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that also is like that.

original: spyi'i yul la zhugs pa na yang tshad ma gcig tu smra ba nyid la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i yul la zhugs pa na yang tshad ma gcig tu smra ba nyid la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Even when they engage in general objects, they are proponents of a single valid cognition.

original: yang na gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis zhes rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de spangs pas gzhal bya ba gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: yang na gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis zhes rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de spangs pas gzhal bya ba gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir na /
translated: Or, the assertion that there are two valid cognitions because there are two objects of comprehension is refuted, and therefore many valid cognitions engage in a single object of comprehension.

original: tshad ma rnam pa mang po nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam pa mang po nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is asserted that there are many types of valid cognition.

original: de yang na /
analyzed: de yang na /
translated: And the statement

original: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because two objects of comprehension are seen,

original: gsum gcig grangs kyang bsal ba yin //
analyzed: gsum gcig grangs kyang bsal ba yin //
translated: The enumeration of three or one is also refuted

original: zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de sel phyogs snga ma 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de sel phyogs snga ma 'di yin no //
translated: is the refutation of the former position.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag yul nges pas gcig la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag yul nges pas gcig la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because direct perception and inference engage in their objects with ascertainment, they do not engage in the same object.🔽Therefore the statement🔽Because there are two objects of comprehension, there are two valid cognitions in general and so on is completely incorrect.

original: gzhal bya ba gnyis ni spyir tsha dam gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang brjod pa ni ma nyam pa kho na'o zhes lan 'debs pa ni de yang mi rigs te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya ba gnyis ni spyir tsha dam gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang brjod pa ni ma nyam pa kho na'o zhes lan 'debs pa ni de yang mi rigs te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the response.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i khyad par la ni ngo shes pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i khyad par la ni ngo shes pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is impossible to recognize a difference that is seen by direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na skad so sor zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na skad so sor zhes gsungs te /
translated: Why? Because of the difference in sound.

original: tha dad pa gzhan dang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan dang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the existence of a different sound.

original: ci ste thad pa gzhan nyid la ngo shes pa yin no zhe na de'i tshe skabs nyams so zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ci ste thad pa gzhan nyid la ngo shes pa yin no zhe na de'i tshe skabs nyams so zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: But if recognition is of a different sound, then the context is lost.

original: khyad par yul can nyid kyang min //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par yul can nyid kyang min // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The context is lost because it is not the subject of the difference.

original: de la gzhan pa'i yul can yin na ni skabs su bab pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i khyad par gyi yul can nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan pa'i yul can yin na ni skabs su bab pa mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i khyad par gyi yul can nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the subject of a different object, then it is not the subject of the difference that is seen by direct perception in the context.

original: skad cig de rang gi ngo bos de'i yun ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon na sum gyis mthong ba'i skad cig dang // byi ma'i skad cig de mtshungs par du ba'i sgo nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig de rang gi ngo bos de'i yun ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon na sum gyis mthong ba'i skad cig dang // byi ma'i skad cig de mtshungs par du ba'i sgo nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The moment is not the object of that by its own nature, but rather the moment that is seen by direct perception is the object of that by the method of smoke.

original: de ltar na yang rjes su dpag pa de ni spyir mthong ba nyid ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rjes su dpag pa de ni spyir mthong ba nyid ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: But still, it is not a perception in general.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: When, as explained,

original: tha dad pa ni rnam par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni rnam par gyur pa'o //
translated: it is different, i.e., transformed,

original: gal te sngar mthong ba'i khyad par gyi yul can ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te sngar mthong ba'i khyad par gyi yul can ma yin na /
translated: if it is not the object of a previous perception,

original: yod ba'i khyad par gyi yul can nyid du 'gyur ngo zhe na /
analyzed: yod ba'i khyad par gyi yul can nyid du 'gyur ngo zhe na /
translated: it would be the object of an existent perception.

original: tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Different, i.e.,

original: gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni yod pa la'o //
analyzed: gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni yod pa la'o //
translated: transformed, i.e., existent.🔽By the addition of the suffix🔽, i.e., by the addition of the suffix

original: lhag par zhe na pas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang gcig par lhag par zhen pas so //
analyzed: lhag par zhe na pas zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang gcig par lhag par zhen pas so //
translated: , it is as if it were the same as the perception.

original: phyir nyid ces bya ba ni khyad par yod par yul du byed pa ni ma yin @153a * //
analyzed: phyir nyid ces bya ba ni khyad par yod par yul du byed pa ni ma yin @153a * //
translated: But, i.e., it is not the object of an existent perception.

original: pa'o // de ltar na gnyi ga lta yang khyad par gyi yul can nyid ma yin no zhes dgon pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // de ltar na gnyi ga lta yang khyad par gyi yul can nyid ma yin no zhes dgon pa'o //
translated: Thus, in both cases, it is not the object of a perception.

original: 'on te rtag par phyogs la sngon mthong ba'i khyad par yul nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtag par phyogs la sngon mthong ba'i khyad par yul nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is the object of a previous perception,

original: dogs pa ni 'o na zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni 'o na zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Doubt” is expressed by “if you say . . . ”

original: de la ni bstan pa la'o /
analyzed: de la ni bstan pa la'o /
translated: “In that case” refers to the teaching.

original: lan ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The answer” is expressed by “it is said . . . ”

original: 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: “unchanging”

original: ci'i phyir mi rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rtogs snyam na /
translated: Why is it not understood?

original: mi sdang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If it is not hostile”

original: 'gyur ba med pa nyid du dogs pa ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa nyid du dogs pa ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is there doubt about its being unchanging?

original: gzhan du yang ni gsal ba gzhan du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ni gsal ba gzhan du'o //
translated: “In another” refers to another manifestation.

original: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni rnams par 'gyur ba med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni rnams par 'gyur ba med pa nyid du'o //
translated: “In that way” refers to its being unchanging.

original: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: “In that case” is the answer.

original: gsal ba gzhan la rnam par 'gyur ba med par mthong ba ni'o //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan la rnam par 'gyur ba med par mthong ba ni'o //
translated: “If it is seen that another manifestation is unchanging”

original: khyad par gyi yul can ma yin gyi 'on kyang spyi'i yul can yin te des na sbyor ba mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par gyi yul can ma yin gyi 'on kyang spyi'i yul can yin te des na sbyor ba mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa nyid do //
translated: It is not a subject that has a specific object, but rather it has a general object. Therefore, it is an inference based on seeing a connection.

original: gal te khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pas ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba'i khyad par nyid du byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pas ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba'i khyad par nyid du byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is an inference based on seeing a specific object, then at the time of apprehending the connection, does it not make the specific object that was seen its object?

original: de dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhes dgos pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhes dgos pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The purpose is to show that it is not like that.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i dus na rjes su dpag par bya ba gang yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i dus na rjes su dpag par bya ba gang yin pa nyid do //
translated: The word that refers to what is to be inferred when perception does not operate.

original: des na dgos pa'i don ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i khyad par byed pa kha na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na dgos pa'i don ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i khyad par byed pa kha na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the purpose is to show that the difference is seen by perception.

original: lan ni dpe nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni dpe nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: because it is an example.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: If, as explained,

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sngar mngon sum gyis grub pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sngar mngon sum gyis grub pa la'o //
translated: in this case, referring to what was previously established by perception,

original: ji ltar 'di las rjes su dpag pa don med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di las rjes su dpag pa don med pa yin zhe na /
translated: how is inference meaningless in this case?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If, as explained,

original: de'i tshe de nyid kyis zhes bya ba sngar gyi mngon sum nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid kyis zhes bya ba sngar gyi mngon sum nyid kyis so //
translated: then by that itself, by the previous perception itself,

original: 'o na de gang du 'jug snyam na rjes su dpag pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na de gang du 'jug snyam na rjes su dpag pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: where does that operate? It is said: in inference.

original: de nyid la ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi yul nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi yul nyid la'o //
translated: In that itself, in the domain of perception itself,

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sogs pa ste /
translated: “If” is another’s opinion.

original: mngon sum gyi yul la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the very engagement with the object of perception.

original: lan ni khyad par zhes bya ba ste gzung ba'i 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni khyad par zhes bya ba ste gzung ba'i 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The answer is “distinction,” because it is the apprehension of the object of apprehension.

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa spong 'dod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa spong 'dod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The desire to abandon the apprehension of the object is “why?”

original: gzhan ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The other is what will arise.

original: sgrub par bye dam dam pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrub par bye dam dam pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is the supreme means of accomplishment, it is valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “if.”

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba dang rjes su dpag par bya ba dag gcig ma yin pa'i phyir na khyad par gyi yul can ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba dang rjes su dpag par bya ba dag gcig ma yin pa'i phyir na khyad par gyi yul can ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because what is seen by perception and what is to be inferred are not the same, it is not the object of distinction. This is the intention.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni @153b rnam 'grel la 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni @153b rnam 'grel la 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: “But” introduces the commentary.

original: de ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'o //
translated: That is what is to be inferred.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na ni brjed pa nyid kyi phyir na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na ni brjed pa nyid kyi phyir na'o //
translated: Because of that very thing, it is forgotten.

original: re zhig rtsod pa'i cha rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig rtsod pa'i cha rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first part of the argument is stated in the words “If you say.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba nyid du'o //
translated: ” “Just as” means just as it was seen before.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “But then” is the conclusion.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni dpe'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni dpe'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “By way of example” clarifies that.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: “That” is the example.

original: 'on te ma brjod na de'i tshe nyis pa yod do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te ma brjod na de'i tshe nyis pa yod do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: “But if you do not say that, then there is a second fault.”🔽“If you say that the reason.

original: gal te rtags kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rtags kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ” is the response.

original: de ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'o //
translated: “That is seen by direct perception.”

original: grub zin pa grub na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya ba'o //🔽brjod ba yang nyes pa yod do //
analyzed: grub zin pa grub na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya ba'o // brjod ba yang nyes pa yod do //
translated: “If you say that what has already been established is established again, then there is an infinite regress,” is the response.

original: zhes brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “But if you say that there is a fault in the expression,” is the response.

original: brjed pa dpe ma yin mod //
analyzed: brjed pa dpe ma yin mod //
translated: “But if you say that the example is not forgotten,” is the response.

original: de med pa kho nar du blor bur ba las med rtogs pa bzhin du rtags las rtogs pa gang gis zlog par byed snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de med pa kho nar du blor bur ba las med rtogs pa bzhin du rtags las rtogs pa gang gis zlog par byed snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: “But if you say that it is just like the cognition of a momentary object that is not present, how can you refute the cognition from a reason?”

original: 'du byed mnyam pa'i mngon sum gyis bzung ba la de mi srid pa nyid la srad kyi tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mnyam pa'i mngon sum gyis bzung ba la de mi srid pa nyid la srad kyi tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: “How is it possible?”

original: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to what is seen by direct perception.

original: khyab pa de'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba gang yin pa de'i khyad par rtogs pa med pas so //
analyzed: khyab pa de'i zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba gang yin pa de'i khyad par rtogs pa med pas so //
translated: “The pervasion of that” refers to the absence of the realization of the distinction of what is to be inferred.

original: sngar gyi mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar gyi mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By the previous direct perception”

original: mthong ba'i 'du byed ma nyams pa can gyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i 'du byed ma nyams pa can gyis so //
translated: refers to the unimpaired seeing of conditioned phenomena.

original: ji ltar khyad par ma rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par ma rtogs she na /
translated: How is the distinction not realized?

original: dus kyi cha zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dus kyi cha zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “The part of time.”

original: rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of permanence.

original: mthong ba'i 'du byed nyams na ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin po zhes dgongs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i 'du byed nyams na ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma yin po zhes dgongs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: If the seen conditioned phenomena are impaired, then it is an inference. The intention is:

original: dran pa yod na zhes bya ba de rjes su dpag pa yod na'o //
analyzed: dran pa yod na zhes bya ba de rjes su dpag pa yod na'o //
translated: “If memory exists” means if inference exists.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i 'du byed nyams pa'i mngon sum gyis bzung ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i 'du byed nyams pa'i mngon sum gyis bzung ba la'o //
translated: The phrase in that case refers to the case where the direct perception apprehends the deterioration of the formative forces that are seen.

original: tha snyad byed pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: tha snyad byed pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase because it is the basis for the conventional expression is to be supplied.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa 'di ltar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa 'di ltar zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase this is what is meant clarifies this.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin can gyi mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin can gyi mtshan nyid las so //
translated: The phrase through a logical argument based on the nature of things means that it is based on the nature of things that are characterized by that.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe la mthong ba'i byed pa dang / chos mtshungs par tha snyad byed pa na'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe la mthong ba'i byed pa dang / chos mtshungs par tha snyad byed pa na'o //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the way things are refers to the conventional expression that is based on the similarity of attributes that is seen in the example.

original: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
translated: The phrase inference is a means of valid knowledge is the topic.🔽If one asks, In what way is there a conventional expression?

original: gang la ji lta ba bzhin tha snyad byed snyam na bdag nyid thams cad ces gsungs te /🔽mi gsal ba'i mngon sum gyis bdag nyid thams cad @154a * //
analyzed: gang la ji lta ba bzhin tha snyad byed snyam na bdag nyid thams cad ces gsungs te / mi gsal ba'i mngon sum gyis bdag nyid thams cad @154a * //
translated: the root text states, in its entirety.

original: bzung zin pa nyid las so //
analyzed: bzung zin pa nyid las so //
translated: The phrase because it apprehends the entirety of itself means that the direct perception that is not clear apprehends the entirety of itself.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is not the case rejects the objection.

original: ci'i phyir de lta na ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta na ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: sngon zhes gsungs te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la'o //
analyzed: sngon zhes gsungs te rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs la'o //
translated: Because of the word “before.”

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par mthong ba las so //🔽lta zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su dpag pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni khyad par mthong ba las so // lta zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rjes su dpag pa'am /
translated: Here, the word “here” refers to the perception of a difference.🔽The word “view” refers to an inference based on a reason of nature.

original: glo bur ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i ltar te /
analyzed: glo bur ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i ltar te /
translated: Or, it refers to an inference based on a non-existent reason.

original: bsgrub par bya ba zhes pa ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba zhes pa ni skabs yin no //
translated: The word “probandum” is in apposition.

original: ci'i phyir de lta ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: sngon zhes gsungs te khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa las sngar ro //
analyzed: sngon zhes gsungs te khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa las sngar ro //
translated: Because of the word “before.” The inference based on the perception of a difference is before.

original: de 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa la brjod pa nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa la brjod pa nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no such thing. The expression “because there is no connection” means because there is no expression of the connection.

original: rang gi gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa ltar sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi gzhan gyi rjes su dpag pa ltar sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a proof like an inference for oneself or for another.

original: glo bur pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang 'dra bar sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa na /
analyzed: glo bur pa'i rjes su dpag pa dang 'dra bar sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa na /
translated: It is also not a proof like an inference based on a non-existent reason.

original: goms pas bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: goms pas bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not produced by habituation.

original: glu bur pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ni goms pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: glu bur pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ni goms pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The inference of the adventitious is one that is produced by habituation.

original: des na de ltar khyad par mthong ba ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i yul can ma yin la /
analyzed: des na de ltar khyad par mthong ba ni mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i yul can ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the perception of a difference is not the perception of the object of direct perception.

original: de'i yul can yin yang tshad ma gzhan ma yin no zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: de'i yul can yin yang tshad ma gzhan ma yin no zhes brjod nas /
translated: Even though it is the perception of that object, it is not another means of valid knowledge.

original: da ni de'i yul can ma yin pa rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di ni mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni de'i yul can ma yin pa rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di ni mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, in order to state that it is only inference that is not the perception of that object, he says, “This is the perception.

original: ci'i phyir ma 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma 'brel zhe na /
translated: Why is it not related?

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, “In another way.”
