translated: And that exclusion of other is what causes the engagement of a person.

original: de'i phyir rgyu rnam pa 'di gnyis kyi phyir na mnyan pa ni gzhan sel bar byed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu rnam pa 'di gnyis kyi phyir na mnyan pa ni gzhan sel bar byed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of these two reasons, the listener is the eliminator of other.

original: phyi rol de'i tha snyad kyi yul dang rgyu de'i dngos po nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ste gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol de'i tha snyad kyi yul dang rgyu de'i dngos po nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ste gnas pa'o //
translated: The object of the convention of external things is posited as the entity of the cause of that.

original: gal te shes pa de las lhag par sgre btags pa la lhag par zhen pa zhes brjod pa yin gyi de la ma rtogs kyang 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don du rtsod pa brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba la
analyzed: gal te shes pa de las lhag par sgre btags pa la lhag par zhen pa zhes brjod pa yin gyi de la ma rtogs kyang 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don du rtsod pa brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba la
translated: If it is said that the attachment to the superimposition of something more than that consciousness is called attachment, but it is not the cause of engagement even without understanding that, the opponent's statement is In that case... and so on.

original: sogs pa'o // shes pa gzhan yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: sogs pa'o // shes pa gzhan yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If it is said that it is indeed another consciousness, what is the problem?

original: gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes gsungs so //
translated: If... is stated.

original: des zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhe na pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhe na pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pas so //
translated: By that means by the nature of attachment, by conceptualization.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa'i lugs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The anticipation of the system of the Naiyāyika and so on is Elsewhere...

original: gang gi tshe smig rgyu la chur sgro btags pa de nyid kyi tshe sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i shes pa de nyid kyis gzhan na gnas pa'i chu 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe smig rgyu la chur sgro btags pa de nyid kyi tshe sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i shes pa de nyid kyis gzhan na gnas pa'i chu 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: When one superimposes water on a mirage, at that time, the cognition that superimposes it apprehends water that exists elsewhere. This is their position.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'dri ba na ci de zhes bya ba ste sgro btags pa de'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'dri ba na ci de zhes bya ba ste sgro btags pa de'o //
translated: When asked about the tenets, they say, “What is that?” That is the superimposition.

original: gzhan gyi lan ni de'o zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lan ni de'o zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent’s response is “That is it.”

original: de ni gzhan na yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni gzhan na yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It exists elsewhere. This is the meaning.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni lhag par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni lhag par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is “How?”

original: gzhan na yod pa'i chu nyid des gzung ba'i phyir sgro btags pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan na yod pa'i chu nyid des gzung ba'i phyir sgro btags pa yin no //
translated: Because it apprehends water that exists elsewhere, it is a superimposition.

original: 'on te med do zhes na zhes bya ba ni gzhan na'o //
analyzed: 'on te med do zhes na zhes bya ba ni gzhan na'o //
translated: If you say “It does not exist,” it exists elsewhere.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Where” refers to a mirage and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni chu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni chu la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to water and so on.

original: de yang ni smig rgyu la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang ni smig rgyu la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: “ That too” refers to a mirage and so on.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ni ga ltar na yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ni ga ltar na yang ngo //
translated: “At that time” means “even though. ”

original: 'di'i lan ni de la de rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni de la de rtogs pa ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to that is “the understanding of that. ”

original: 'di nyid kyi don brjod pa ni de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi don brjod pa ni de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of that is stated: “that” and so on.

original: don de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: don de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If the meaning is like that, what is the problem?

original: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba'o //🔽'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste chu la sogs pa med pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba'o // 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste chu la sogs pa med pa nyid la'o //
translated: “At that time” and so on.🔽“Or” is a doubt.

original: med pa nyid ces grub pa'i mtha' dang ldan pas dris pa na gzhan gyi lan ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid ces grub pa'i mtha' dang ldan pas dris pa na gzhan gyi lan ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When asked about the nonexistence of water and so on, the opponent’s answer is “that” and so on.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: “No” is a refutation.

original: chu la sogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu ba dag la rtogs pa'i chu ni gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan gyis med par rtogs //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu ba dag la rtogs pa'i chu ni gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan gyis med par rtogs //
translated: The water that is understood in a mirage is not the domain of another, so how could it be understood as nonexistent by another?

original: bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa'i chu ni gzhan gyis yul du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa'i chu ni gzhan gyis yul du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The water that is understood by oneself is not the domain of another.
